jobText: TXT/50631862.txt	§Principal Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Planner§§Advertiser: §Lands and Survey Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Lands and Survey Whangarei is a multi-disciplinary surveying, planning and engineering company that has been providing services to the Northland region for over 30 years. We pride ourselves in putting people first with a focus on exceptional customer service and a great work environment. §We are currently searching for a new Principal Planner who is comfortable growing client relationships, ensuring our planning team are well supported, and the unit functions in an efficient and profitable manner.§This role will require a high degree of leadership, and the ability to work as part of a wider management team.  §Key requirements:§Client management, effective communications and relationship building§Planning team leadership including technical direction, encouraging a good team culture and supporting staff retention§Management of planning projects including planning applications, plan changes, consenting, scoping reports, design and policy guidance; workflow and assignment of jobs§Several years of management experience in a Senior Planning role; recognised qualification§Ensure that technical work is completed§Exceptional communication skills with customers, staff and external consultants§A positive, friendly, can-do attitude; be able to think on your feet and make fast decisions with a hands-on approach§Desire to be proactive in the growth of the business to achieve set goals§High level of professionalism in all areas at all times§Experience delivering outstanding results in health and safety §Has the right to work in New Zealand§ §On offer:§Competitive salary package §Usual tools of the trade incl phone, laptop and vehicle as required for business needs§Opportunities for further training and development in a growing business§Work with a fabulous group of skilled people in a professional, dynamic environment§Work-life balance - we offer flexible working arrangements and have a family-friendly office.§ §If you have the relevant experience, a great attitude and are looking to reach your potential within a supportive company, please forward your application to fiona@landsandsurvey.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have with project planning and scheduling?§How many years of business development experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Graduate Consultant Opportunitites Job in Wellington - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50588000.txt	§Graduate Consultant Opportunitites§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate Consultant Opportunitites§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§We are looking for motivated Graduates to join our fast-paced consultancy firm in Wellington§ §Allen + Clarke§ is a Wellington and Melbourne based consultancy company that provides policy and regulatory advice, business change, research and evaluation, and governance, secretariat and programme support services to government, private sector and not-for-profit clients in New Zealand, Australia, the Pacific and Asia.  We are well-recognised as a policy leader: our clients come to us for trusted advice on a wide range of issues.  You can find out more about us at www.allenandclarke.co.nz.§ §We are looking for motivated Graduates to take on a role that:§ § §includes a diverse range of work§ §provides opportunities to learn and develop, and§ §is busy and constantly changing.§ §We work hard and fast to meet our clients’ needs by delivering excellent products. They appreciate our creative and challenging approach and have confidence in our proven ability to deliver practical solutions to their issues. Our local and global experience makes us a business partner of choice for many public sector agencies. Our projects can be long or short term. They can be individual or team-based. They may involve working in-house with our clients or at our offices. § §Allen + Clarke§ provides a collegial environment. We invest in our people and support them to grow their policy, regulation, research, evaluation, governance, secretariat, and project management skills. Our people are flexible, hardworking, and committed. They know how to work with pace and enjoy working on multiple streams of work without dropping the ball. They are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure a project’s success. Our people enjoy working within a team environment that also offers scope for autonomy. They have great relationship management skills and work comfortably with a wide range of people including our clients. § §We are looking for Graduates who have these skills. Applicants will need to demonstrate:§ § §awareness of work in the following areas: § §policy and regulatory§ §governance, secretariat and programme support and/or§ §research and evaluation§ § § §ability to self-manage and to manage multiple pieces of work at the same time§ §ability to work successfully within, and make a contribution to, a team, and§ §an awareness of kaupapa Māori principles.§ §To apply for this position please email your CV and a brief cover letter to §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§. Additionally, we ask all applicants to answer the following questions in a separate document and attach it to their application.§ §Please answer the following questions, in 200 words or less:§ § §Why are you interested in working for §Allen + Clarke?§ §What you will bring to §Allen + Clarke §from your life or work experience?§ §What do you bring to working as part of a team?§ §If you have any questions, please contact Lizzie Johnsen on 021 594 780 or §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§.§ §The roles are Wellington based and will start at the end of January 2021§ §All applicants for this position must have the right to work in New Zealand.§ §Applications close 5pm Friday the 9th of October§§§§

Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.§        §Joining KPMG means joining a talented team of exceptional colleagues who bring innovative thoughts and a natural curiosity to the work they do each day. No one type of person succeeds at KPMG; a diverse business requires diverse personalities, characters and perspectives. There really is a place for you here.§        §KPMG's Advisory business partners with clients to help them address complex business problems to ensure sustainable business outcomes; from distilling 'big data' to reveal valuable insights, to improving operational performance, optimising risk, restructuring an operation or seizing a new business opportunity.§        §The role:§        §A role as a bring ideas into pragmatic, real world future operating models with strong value propositions and tangible benefits§          §Negotiate and deliver on client expectations§          §Ensure ensure our service quality is maintained§        §        §To be successful in this role you'll have:§        §          §Minimum 7 years experience in Management Consulting working across multiple written and oral communications skills and strong interpersonal skills §          §A 'can-do' attitude and a strong sense of ownership to get the job done in a practical and pragmatic fashion § jobText: TXT/50670347.txt	§Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consultant§§Advertiser: §Xyst Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§About Xyst§ §Xyst is a multi-disciplinary team of experienced parks and recreation professionals. We support local government and other agencies in the sustainable planning and management of parks and recreation facilities, to create better towns and cities in which to live and play.§ §We have consultants working across New Zealand, Australia and Canada from home offices and a head office in downtown Napier. We offer a modern flexible working environment with outstanding work life balance benefits - in summer our team has every Friday off and gets paid for it!§ §We are practical people, most with significant experience in the local government parks and recreation sector.  Our diverse skillsets, industry knowledge and proven track record set us apart from others. We love what we do and are excited about the difference we can make to local communities and the environment.§ §About the role§ §As a consultant you will work on a wide variety of projects primarily for local and central government and not-for-profit organisations.  You will use your specific skills such  planning, project management, iwi and community engagement and your technical knowledge to provide great advice and outcomes for our clients.§ §You need to be a highly motivated and competent individual with a passion for your craft. You will have excellent writing skills and be a great communicator.   § §You might be a planner, landscape architect, project manager, researcher, arborist, ecologist, amenity horticulture specialist or recent graduate - we are open to see what skills and knowledge you can bring to Xyst.§ §As a minimum we expect:§ §- great written and spoken communication skills§ §- two to five years experience in local government or private practice§ §- a knowledge of te reo Māori and tikanga is an advantage § §This a great opportunity for someone to grow into our company and bring their own skills and experience to Xyst. We offer a good salary, an outstanding work-life balance, flexible working arrangements including location and interesting, diverse work.§ §How to apply§ §Apply for this job with a CV and cover letter outlining your experience and what skills you can bring to Xyst.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50692640.txt	§Business Case Adviser §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Case Adviser §§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Business Case Adviser §        §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga§ - §About the role§          §We are looking for an experienced Business Case Adviser to join our team, either in an advisory capacity or as a senior in the team.  You'll get to be part of an exciting piece of work, Sustainable Food & Fibre Futures, which supports problem-solving and innovation in New Zealand's food and fibre sectors.  §          §Projects range from small grants and community-led grass roots initiatives to multi-year, multi-million-dollar partnerships.  You will be working independently assessing SFF Futures applications prior to submission to decision making forums, as well as engaging with external stakeholders for development of SFF Futures applications and business cases.  §          §Your ability to foster and maintain relationships with key stakeholders will be crucial to your success in this role. Our key stakeholders include (but are not limited to) iwi, Māori organisations, industry groups, regional councils etc.  §          §As an experienced Senior or Adviser, you will bring:§          §            §Phenomenal stakeholder relationship skills. Existing relationships with the key stakeholders listed above would be very beneficial§          §          §            §An understanding of business case development and assessment§            §Experience of what drives decision making within private sector businesses and how they operate§            §Tikanga Māori, embedding this in your day-to-day work§            §Financial capability and experience to assess business case financials and economics, including assessing cash flow and balance sheets§            §Experience and understanding of working with a cross section of stakeholders, often in politically sensitive environments§            §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§            §Experience working for or with Māori agribusiness or primary sector organisations would be very beneficial.  §          §          §You will also have the opportunity to work on a variety of other interesting topics across the Investment Analysis team, this is a great time to join MPI, if you want a career where you help to grow New Zealand in a very real way. §          §This is a permanent part time (24 hours per week) opportunity.§          §Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§          §The Investment Analysis team manages a range of analysis and programme support functions. These include working with applicants to develop and assess funding applications, designing and providing a range of reporting products, and providing coordination support to the directorate.§ §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§ - §About MPI§          §MPI is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. It's no mean feat, and we have a team of hard working and passionate people in a variety of roles both on the ground and in the office supporting us to make this happen.  MPI has a focus on career pathways and we will work with you to help you grow§.  §To see the benefits of working at MPI, please click §here§ §          §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to apply§          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do, please click §here§ §          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click on §"APPLY NOW"§ or visit the MPI Careers site.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal. §          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.  §          §For internal candidates please make sure your current manager is aware of your application. Please note this is an opportunity to move into trade policy at your current level. §          §Applications close 18 October 2020.§          §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Senior Recruitment Adviser §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§ -§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access equirements,we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Kōrero mō te tūranga§ - §About the role§We are looking for an experienced Business Case Adviser to join our team, either in an advisory capacity or as a senior in the team.  You'll get to be part of an exciting piece of work, Sustainable Food & Fibre Futures, which supports problem-solving and innovation in New Zealand's food and fibre sectors.  §Projects range from small grants and community-led grass roots initiatives to multi-year, multi-million-dollar partnerships.  You will be working independently assessing SFF Futures applications prior to submission to decision making forums, as well as engaging with external stakeholders for development of SFF Futures applications and business cases.  §Your ability to foster and maintain relationships with key stakeholders will be crucial to your success in this role. Our key stakeholders include (but are not limited to) iwi, Māori organisations, industry groups, regional councils etc.  §As an experienced Senior or Adviser, you will bring:§§Phenomenal stakeholder relationship skills. Existing relationships with the key stakeholders listed above would be very beneficial§§An understanding of business case development and assessment§Experience of what drives decision making within private sector businesses and how they operate§Tikanga Māori, embedding this in your day-to-day work§Financial capability and experience to assess business case financials and economics, including assessing cash flow and balance sheets§Experience and understanding of working with a cross section of stakeholders, often in politically sensitive environments§Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§Experience working for or with Māori agribusiness or primary sector organisations would be very beneficial.  §§You will also have the opportunity to work on a variety of other interesting topics across the Investment Analysis team, this is a great time to join MPI, if you want a career where you help to grow New Zealand in a very real way. §This is a permanent part time (24 hours per week) opportunity.§§Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§The Investment Analysis team manages a range of analysis and programme support functions. These include working with applicants to develop and assess funding applications, designing and providing a range of reporting products, and providing coordination support to the directorate.§ §§Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§ - §About MPI§MPI is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. Please note this is an opportunity to move into trade policy at your current level. §Applications close 18 October 2020.§If you have any questions about the role, please contact Senior Recruitment Adviser §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§ -§The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. jobText: TXT/50670565.txt	§Adviser – Regional Strategy§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Adviser – Regional Strategy§§Advertiser: §Venture Taranaki Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Salary§§$60,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Adviser – Regional Strategy§Who are you?§As the Adviser – Regional Strategy, you will play a key role in our activities by analysing and collating inputs for the regional strategy, refining and prioritising action plans and supporting sectoral initiatives to underpin our economic development initiatives.  §The role requires excellent writing and analysing skills, experience in developing and implementing collaborative initiatives, and the ability to offer clear, coherent thoughts to help shape thinking. A keen interest in sectors such as energy, engineering and manufacturing would be an advantage.§If this sounds like you, and you want to be part of our regional development team in Taranaki at a pivotal time of change and opportunity, then the Adviser role is one you will relish.§The role will be based in Taranaki, is full time, fixed-term, concludes 30 June 2021 and requires someone for immediate start. § §Who are we?§Venture Taranaki, the Regional Development Agency for Taranaki, is a small, high-performing team widely acknowledged as making a significant difference to the Taranaki region through what we do and how we do it.§Our vision for the future is a Taranaki economy that supports the well-being of our people and environment, underpinned by resilient enterprises, economies and communities. We do this by promoting Taranaki as a great place to learn, live, work, play, visit and create; providing enterprise support and enablement; undertaking research and thought leadership and promoting investment opportunities. §Applications §Monday 12 October 2020§. Please submit all applications on Seek – including CV and a covering letter (with reasons for wanting the job and earliest start date). § §See below for a copy of the position description. § § §Position Description:§ADVISER§ §Accountable to: General Manager Regional Strategy and Sectors§Location:  New Plymouth, Taranaki§Date:  1 October 2020§ §1. The Organisation§ §Venture Taranaki Trust (VT, or the Trust) is Taranaki’s regional development and promotion agency, encompassing a wide range of activities, spanning local and regional economic development and strategy, enterprise innovation and growth, regional promotion and marketing, sector development, and major event attraction. The Trust is a Council Controlled Organisation of the New Plymouth District Council, is governed by an independent Board of Trustees, and guided by the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§ §The long-term impact that we are working towards is a Taranaki economy that supports the well-being of our people and environment, underpinned by resilient enterprises, economies and communities. We do this by:§• Promoting Taranaki as a great place to learn, live, work, play, visit and create§• Providing enterprise support and enablement§• Undertaking research and thought leadership§• Promoting investment in Taranaki.§ §Our work is also guided by Make Way for Taranaki Tapuae Roa, Taranaki’s regional economic development strategy, and by the Taranaki 2050 Roadmap for transitioning to a low emissions economy.  § §Working for us§Venture Taranaki is a small, high-performing team widely acknowledged as making a significant difference to the Taranaki region through what we do and how we do it. We encourage ongoing innovation and improvement and have a strong focus on staff engagement and workplace culture.  The services and projects we deliver are varied and interesting and we endeavour to expose our team to a range of engaging and challenging work. Venture Taranaki is here to serve Taranaki and working with the Trust will allow you to make a meaningful contribution to the community on a daily basis.§ §2. The Role§ §The Adviser role is responsible for advisory and analyst support for the functions of the Regional Strategy and Sector team. This includes analysing and collating inputs to strategy, drafting action plan(s) and submissions, and supporting thought-leadership pieces.  The position also provides analysis, coordination and support for sector activity.  §A key focus of the role is supporting the forward progress, integration and prioritisation of the Taranaki 2050/Tapuae Roa action plans, development of the strategic narrative, promotion and implementation of regional development initiatives.§ §This role is a fixed term contract, on the basis that the position concludes upon completion of the contracted project at 30 June 2021.§ § §Team: Regional Strategy and Sectors  §Reports to: General Regional Strategy and Sectors  §Direct reports: Nil§Indirect reports: Nil§Operating Budget:    As per VT delegation policies§Delegated authority: As per VT delegations and policies§Stakeholders – internal: • VT Board of Trustees§• All VT functions and employees§Stakeholders – external: • Government agencies§• Industry bodies and sector groups§• Taranaki Territorial Local Authorities (TLAs) – NPDC, STDC, SDC and TRC§• Contractors, consultants as required§ § §3. Responsibilities§ §• Supporting the development and implementation of regional and sector strategies and action plans, through analysis and collation of inputs and feedback, and supporting planning and co-ordination.§• Drafting strategies, actions plans and submissions to government proposals§• Supporting the development of ‘thought-leadership’ papers by co-ordinating providers (as appropriate) and production process§• Supporting sector development work by providing analytical support and co-ordinating and collating inputs and feedback, as well as identifying potential growth opportunities or tactics for sectors, and identifying potential new and emerging sectors for the region§• Assisting with project delivery.§• Preparing materials to support regional strategy and sector activity, such as presentations, reports, website material etc§ §Note: These duties may change from time to time to meet operational or other requirements.§ § §4. Skills, Knowledge and Behaviours§ §VT’s core competencies below, outline the skills, knowledge and behaviours that are important to the organisation.§ §Relationship§Management§• Builds and maintains positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders  §• Works well as part of the immediate and the wider team and is supportive and respectful of other team members  §• Consults and collaborates with others as appropriate§• Represents VT in a professional and diplomatic manner§• Demonstrates cultural and political awareness§Planning and Organisation§• Demonstrates effective project management skills§• Demonstrates effective time management skills§• Prioritises competing demands without compromising the quality of work delivered§• Plans ahead and completes projects  §Communication§• Is confident communicating clearly and persuasively to a range of audiences  §• Employs the most appropriate method/medium of communication to reach the desired audience§• Is able to communicate complex ideas and issues in a way that is easy to understand§Problem-solving§• Demonstrates a solutions-based approach to overcoming problems in a positive and constructive manner§• Analyses relevant information in a rational manner to form evidence-based judgements§• Demonstrates creativity and innovation when assessing problems and developing solutions§Strategic Thinking§• Demonstrates knowledge and understanding of the regional, national and international context VT operates within§• Understands the strategic goals of VT and what these mean at an operational level§• Proactively plans and takes appropriate action to achieve goals  §• Demonstrates an awareness of the political environment that VT operates within as a public service entity§Innovation and Change • Looks for opportunities to make improvements and add value§• Works cooperatively with others to develop innovative solutions§• Sees opportunities and responds positively to change§• Is open to feedback and seeks out personal opportunities to learn and grow§Health, Safety and Wellbeing • Complies with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015 and VT’s internal health and safety policies and procedures§• Takes reasonable care of own health and safety while at work§• Actively contributes to promoting a safe working environment§ §5. Qualifications, Experience and Personal Attributes§ §• Strong customer-centric orientation, relationship skills and teamwork§• Experience in developing and implementing collaborative strategies§• Understanding of systems-thinking§• Independent thinking capable of acting as soundboard and able to offer clear, coherent thoughts to challenge and shape thinking§• High standard of communication skills and ability to relate to people across all levels, business sizes, sectors and business maturity§• Ability to clearly articulate ideas and thoughts verbally, and to make presentations to others§• Solution oriented focus  able to evaluate information, problem solve and offer potential solutions§• Collaborative inclusive approach to work practice§• Knowledge of how businesses operate, the issues faced by companies seeking to attract and retain talent§• Knowledge of relevant local, regional, and government  §• A tertiary level qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§• High level of computer literacy§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50610350.txt	§Business Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Consultant§§Advertiser: §Business Success Partners South§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Is it time for a change from the corporate world, or your current career or business? § §Take control of your own destiny and be rewarded for your efforts. § §About the role and opportunity§ §This is a unique opportunity to control your own income as part of a business consulting firm. The beauty of this model - §you work for yourself but not by yourself!§ §Most Business Owners are not trained to run a business. They have skills in their areas of technical expertise but often lack the overall business knowledge that ensures on-going growth, stability and the maximum profitability of their businesses.§ §This is where §Business Success Partners§ comes in. Our team is trained to sit alongside business owners helping them to manage their businesses more effectively. We have tools and processes to apply to any business to capture more profits, better growth and higher value in the business.§ §Skills and Experience§ §We are looking for people to join our growing network across the South Island to assist Business Owners in §Christchurch§ and the §Canterbury region.§ A major bonus is that you can be based, and work from, anywhere in the region.§ §Some key leadership competencies and skills you will need are:§ § §A good general business knowledge§ §To show confidence and leadership§ §To have strong commercial acumen§ §To be able to back yourself with intelligence and practicality§ §To have empathy and the ability to be a good listener§ §Benefits and Culture§ §This is an opportunity to own your own lifestyle with an excellent income to match. You will be provided with intensive training, supported by very good business systems, consulting tools and client acquisition processes to help locate and serve your potential clients and give you every opportunity to build a very rewarding income.§ §This is a unique opportunity to build your own portfolio of clients whilst working alongside a highly experienced 20 strong Consultancy Team who can provide day-to-day support and mentoring.§ §Please only reply to this opportunity if you are a New Zealand Resident, are serious about building your own portfolio of clients and have what it takes to do so. If you are motivated and passionate about business, and have an in-built desire to help Business Owners while creating a rewarding income and lifestyle for yourself - then this is the opportunity for you.§ §When inquiring please include contact details (including a cell phone number) and a summary of why you are interested in working with us. An up-to-date CV would be helpful. All enquiries will be answered,§ §All the best!§ §"It has long come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sit back and let things happen to them. They go out and happen to things."§ §- Leonardo da Vinci§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Consultant, Programme Management Job in Wellington - SEEK
experience: We think the best candidates will have 5+ years
jobText: TXT/50686293.txt	§Senior Consultant, Programme Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant, Programme Management§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Are you ready for a new challenge?  §Allen + Clarke §is looking for an experienced programme manager to join our team.§ §About Us / Ko wai mātou § §Allen + Clarke§ is a consulting company that works with government, NGO and private sector clients on projects that matter. Our Governance, Secretariat and Programmes Practice provides expert services including programme and project management, governance advice and secretariat services, contract, and grant management, and supports independent reviews and inquiries. We work collaboratively with colleagues in our other Practices (Policy + Regulatory and Evaluation + Research) to produce high quality work for our clients. Our projects can be long or short term. They can be individual, or team based. Some are delivered from our offices; others are delivered at our clients.§ §The opportunity / Te Whiwhinga mahi§ §We are looking for an experienced project or programme manager who can provide our clients with hands-on expertise designing and delivering programmes or discrete  projects in major policy, legislative or business change areas. This is a dynamic and challenging position where you will be working across §Allen + Clarke§ and with clients to design and deliver small- and large-scale programmes and projects in a range of policy, regulatory, governance, strategy, business optimisation, research, and evaluation areas.§ §You will have proven ability in project methodology, experience in stakeholder and community engagement, intellectual acumen, and understanding of strategic objectives and what is required to achieve them. You will work efficiently, bringing a calm head to pressured environments. You will also be confident in networking, creating opportunities and securing new business. As a senior consultant, you will  have an important role in raising internal competency in project management.§ §Our consultants are flexible, proactive, hard-working, and committed. They care and want to make a difference. They know how to work with pace. They never lose sight of quality. They are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure success for our clients.§ §About you / Ko wai koe:§ §You will be able to:§ § §Design, plan, and implement programmes and projects including governance frameworks, schedules, reporting, resource, and quality management§ §Produce project briefs, proposals, and business cases including methodology, resource, and budget requirements§ §Identify, analyse, document, manage and monitor issues, risks and opportunities that arise§ §Advise on and negotiate priorities, constraints, interdependencies, requirements, methodology options, phases and decision points§ §Develop and maintain effective and efficient working relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §Confidently speak with clients, stakeholders, and diverse communities§ §Work on numerous different projects at once, with a high level of ambiguity§ §Network and create business opportunities and feel comfortable in this space§ §Be comfortable with a varied work schedule of very busy periods of client work, and periods of self-directed business improvement and development§ §Coach and support team members in professional skills, and§ §Care and want to make a difference.§ §We think the best candidates will have 5+ years’ experience in providing programme management in public or private sector organisations.§ §To apply for this position please email a covering letter and your CV to Lizzie Johnsen at §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§. A copy of the position description is available on request.§ §Applications close / Rā Katinga: § §Applications will close on Monday the 26th of October at 5pm.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50680586.txt	§Change Implementation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Implementation Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §Change Implementation Manager §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35023§        §          §Great opportunity to support change initiatives across Service Delivery and the wider Ministry of Social Development§          §Apply structured change methodologies to projects and key business initiatives to support change readiness and embedding changes§          §2 fixed term/secondment positions to June 2021, National Office, Wellington§        §        §Service Delivery is all about working together to make a difference for New Zealanders. The Change Implementation Manager roles are part of a team that supports and embeds changes within Service Delivery. They are vital in leading activities that will support our people to accept, get ready and embed the change.§        §Using your change implementation expertise, you’ll be responsible for;§        §          §Planning and creating structured integrated change implementation plans that ensure the right people and change activities are coordinated in a sequence that makes sense.§          §Creating strong relationships involving all key stakeholders to ensure the needs of our people are met and there is a smooth transition for impacted stakeholders.§          §Ensuring people who need to know about the change are engaged with and supported and that the end goal is conveyed.§          §Implementing and delivering the change activities necessary to drive and support successful change including supporting the communication, engagement, training and post implementation activities to embed the required changes.§          §Analysing the impacts from several perspectives to identify any gaps and understand what supports, connections, and resources are needed.§          §Understanding what other changes are impacting our people across Service Delivery so you can provide an integrated approach.§        §        §To be successful in these roles you’ll need to have a real passion for change and supporting people to understand and accept change. Experience managing multiply pieces of work at the same time and working to deadlines is an advantage. You’ll be supporting anything from a small process changes to large business improvements giving a wide variety of work and engagement with people.§        §How to apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.§        §All applications must be made online. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35023§ § §Great opportunity to support change initiatives across Service Delivery and the wider Ministry of Social Development§ §Apply structured change methodologies to projects and key business initiatives to support change readiness and embedding changes§ §2 fixed term/secondment positions to June 2021, National Office, Wellington§ §Service Delivery is all about working together to make a difference for New Zealanders. The Change Implementation Manager roles are part of a team that supports and embeds changes within Service Delivery. They are vital in leading activities that will support our people to accept, get ready and embed the change.§ §Using your change implementation expertise, you’ll be responsible for;§ § §Planning and creating structured integrated change implementation plans that ensure the right people and change activities are coordinated in a sequence that makes sense.§ §Creating strong relationships involving all key stakeholders to ensure the needs of our people are met and there is a smooth transition for impacted stakeholders.§ §Ensuring people who need to know about the change are engaged with and supported and that the end goal is conveyed.§ §Implementing and delivering the change activities necessary to drive and support successful change including supporting the communication, engagement, training and post implementation activities to embed the required changes.§ §Analysing the impacts from several perspectives to identify any gaps and understand what supports, connections, and resources are needed.§ §Understanding what other changes are impacting our people across Service Delivery so you can provide an integrated approach.§ §To be successful in these roles you’ll need to have a real passion for change and supporting people to understand and accept change. jobText: TXT/50694859.txt	§Data analytics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data analytics§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Analyst Level 2§§Full time, Permanent §§Wellington§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated level two analyst from a quantitative background to join a high performing team of modellers making a difference in the Justice Sector.§You may be a developing analyst looking for the experience you need to progress to senior, or have just a few years' experience and looking for the next step. The beauty of this model - §you work for yourself but not by yourself!§ §Most Business Owners are not trained to run a business. They have skills in their areas of technical expertise but often lack the overall business knowledge that ensures on-going growth, stability and maximum profitability of their businesses.§ §Skills and Experience§ §Business Success Partners§ is looking for people to join our growing network across the South Island to assist Business Owners in §Invercargill§ and the §Southland region.§ A major bonus is that you can be based, and work from, anywhere in the region.§ §Some key leadership competencies and skills you will need are:§ § §A good general business knowledge§ §To show confidence and leadership§ §To have strong commercial acumen§ §To be able to back yourself with intelligence and practicality§ §To have empathy and the ability to be a good listener§ §Benefits and Culture§ §This is an opportunity to own your own lifestyle with an excellent income to match. You will be provided with intensive training, supported by very good business systems, consulting tools and client acquisition processes to help locate your potential clients and give you every opportunity to build a very rewarding income.§ §This is a unique opportunity to build your own portfolio of clients whilst working alongside a highly experienced 20 strong Consultancy Team who will provide day-to-day support and mentoring.§ §Please only reply to this opportunity if you are a New Zealand Resident, are serious about building your own portfolio of clients and have what it takes to do so. If you are motivated and passionate about business, and have an in-built desire to help Business Owners while creating a rewarding income and lifestyle for yourself - then this is the opportunity for you.§ §When inquiring please include contact details (including a cell phone number) and a summary of why you are interested in working with us. § §All the best!§ §"It has long come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sit back and let things happen to them. jobText: TXT/50685853.txt	§Principal Advisor - Strategic Languages Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor - Strategic Languages Development§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ § §Languages development will sit front and centre across multiple programmes of work§ §Passion and linguistic experience in the revitalisation of Pacific Languages § §High-performing team that reaches across government and communities to support collaborative work § §  § You will provide support and professional leadership to the languages unit and deliver high quality, robust advice relating to the theory and practice of language revitalisation. A key function of the role is the ability to lead and influence change at a systems and strategic level, be innovative and forward thinking.§  § §Our purpose §  § The Ministry for Pacific People make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§  § §What you will do in this role is:§ § §Support the Director of Languages to identify and lead strategic development for new opportunities to enhance the languages across our Pacific nations into wider government programmes – influencing social policy through relationships.§ §Lead strategic language development work across community, cross-agency and project teams to support and influence language revitalisation of Pacific Languages into fabric of Aotearoa.§ §Develop reports, papers and submissions to Cabinet Office and Select Committee for Language related information.§ §Provide intellectual and linguistic subject matter expertise and leadership in language development programmes both within the Ministry and to external agencies and organisations.§ §Providing robust language design that meets agency and /or community culture, values and operating models§ §  § §To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § §Linguistic background and solid experience in languages ideally within an Education background§ §Sound network across government, and across Education sector that enables collaboration and focus towards better outcomes for Pacific People around language revitalisation.§ §Excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ §Good understanding of the machinery of government and how to navigate it.§ §Strong stakeholder engagement skills and the ability to engage with different audiences.§ §  § §Working for us§  § At Ministry for Pacific People, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, healthcare insurance, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At Ministry for Pacific People, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our Lalanga Fou goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand§  § If you would like more information or a position description, please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 25 October 2020.§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50560269.txt	§Superstar Business Coach - Your Opportunity in an Unusual Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Superstar Business Coach - Your Opportunity in an Unusual Industry§§Advertiser: §Tony Fraser-Jones§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$100,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Over the last few years our business has grown by 50% plus year-on-year and we need a Coaching Superstar so we can help more clients succeed with their businesses.§  §Profitable Tradie is a NZ based Business Coaching company with an international reputation for making a difference in the lives of the owners of plumbing, electrical and similar construction-based service businesses across New Zealand, Australia, and North America.§  §Our mission is to turn great tradespeople into great business owners!!! §  §If you’re keen for a fresh challenge, want to push your boundaries and grow not only your earning potential, but yourself as a person and want to be part of a team of energetic, like minded high achievers then we should talk.§  §Fun, energy and a willingness to learn is part of the deal. You’ll be a connector but also a person who focuses on results. To be clear, that means you know how to get alongside people and demonstrate empathy, but you can also deliver the message in a “pull no punches” manner when needed 😉. §  §So, what does a Coach in a Business Coaching company for Tradies do? §  §First, our clients are the owners of established plumbing, electrical and similar construction-based service businesses – typically between 4 and 60 employees.   §  §Your role will be to ensure our clients have a world class experience which results in them growing their profits, creating a better lifestyle for themselves and growing as a person (nobody can improve their business without improving themselves).§  §You’ll be a “doer” and a “designer.”§  §The “doing” involves presenting coaching webinars, one-on-one coaching sessions, creating coaching resources, monitoring client engagement and results, maintaining our online coaching portals and Facebook Groups.  You will step into a well-developed coaching system. §  §The “designing” involves a relentless focus on how we can improve our coaching systems to help our clients win even quicker.  You’ll be amped to identify and implement business improvement projects. §  §Although the role does not have any direct reports initially, our growth plans see you building a coaching team in the future. §  §Your role comes with a strong remuneration package made up of a base salary plus performance bonuses.§  §We’ve found the key to your success in our world is “fit” with our company values. Most businesses talk values, but it’s all talk. We walk the talk.§  §You’ll possess a strong sense of self-confidence (but in a humble and modest way 😊) meaning you are sure of your ability to succeed.§  §You bring energy, relentless positivity, and an above the line attitude to work every day. In other words, no excuses and total accountability for your results.§  §You connect quickly with people, are fun to hang out with and you make everyone around you feel good about their experience with you – most importantly your teammates!    §  §We may be a based in little ol’ NZ, but you’ll vibe with being part of a world class operation.   §  §And if you love learning, podcasts, audio books and reading about business and personal development, we’re the mothership you’ve been looking for.§  §Plus, you bring strong business acumen and an understanding of how a business works (things like gross profit, margins, profit and loss and managing teams are second nature).§  §Oh, and strength in personal communication is crucial. Preferably in small to medium business settings. You may even have experience with coaching or training in the past and/or have an affinity with the construction industry.  §  §The role is primarily based at our office in Hamilton but there is potential to work remotely for one or two days per week.§  §My role as the founder and CEO is to recruit the best talent. If this sounds like you, apply now. There is only one opportunity.§  §Apply today by sending your §CV§ and a §video presentation§ (no more than 4 minutes) where you answer the following question: “What Does It Take to Create a Successful Business?”§  §Check out our website at www.profitabletradie.com or Facebook https://www.facebook.com/profitabletradie/§  §Life is about moments…is this your moment?§ §  §Send your application to §jo@profitabletradie.com§  §Applications close at 4pm on Friday 9 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50528247.txt	§Senior Consultant, Governance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant, Governance§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§ §Be recognised as an expert in the provision of practical governance and Board level meeting management services§ §Use your tried and tested project management skills§ §Apply your people management knowhow§ §Work on a variety of projects, for a range of clients§ §Grow our Governance, Secretariat + Programmes Practice§ §Bring your 'can-do' attitude§ §Join a flexible, hard-working, and committed team§ §Help us to make a difference§.§ §Are you looking for a new challenge?  §Allen + Clarke§ needs someone with extensive experience supporting decision-makers to make the right calls. You may have led the provision of governance or meeting management services to advisory bodies like committees or Boards, managed complex projects from start to finish or implemented new policies or services. You need to be able to plan, lead and deliver all elements of high-quality secretariat services within a team environment. Identifying and chasing new opportunities energises you. You can work consciously across cultures and successfully engage with senior leaders and diverse communities with differing cultural, social, and political frameworks. This position is based at our Wellington office in The Woolstore in Thorndon.§  §Allen + Clarke §is a consultancy company that works with government, NGO and private sector clients on projects that matter. Our Governance, Secretariat + Programmes Practice works collaboratively with colleagues in our other Practices (Policy + Regulatory and Evaluation + Research). Our projects can be long or short term. They can be individual or team-based. Our people are flexible, hard-working and committed. They care and want to make a difference. They know how to work with pace. They never lose sight of quality. They are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure success for our clients. §  §Come join us if you:§ § §love providing high-quality support to decision-makers (including governance and policy advice and/or meeting management services)§ §are energised by the thought of developing new business opportunities§ §enjoy people management and supporting teams to be the best they can be§ §enjoy delivering pragmatic solutions over multiple projects at one time§ §are comfortable with change and working in a fast-paced environment§ §have an ability to anticipate risks and the consequences of decisions and commitments§ §like networking and meeting new people and have experience in managing diverse relationships§ §have a strong client focus and enjoy working with organisations to identify and meet their needs, and§ §care and want to make a difference.§ §We think the best candidates will have 10+ years' experience in providing a wide range of governance and meeting management services in public or private sector organisations. Demonstrated experience in people management is essential.§  §If you have any questions or would like a copy of the position description, please contact Lizzie Johnsen on 021 594 780 or §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§.§  §To apply, please email a covering letter and your CV to Lizzie at the above address.§  §Applications close at 9am Monday 28th September 2020.  Interviews are likely to be held in early October 2020.§  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50679868.txt	§Change and Engagement Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change and Engagement Specialist§§Advertiser: §Kainga Ora§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Change and Engagement Specialist §      §        §          §Be a catalyst for positive change§          §Influence at all levels using exceptional communication skills§          §Annual salary of $117,000 plus five weeks' annual leave§        §        §Mō mātou - Our Organisation§        §At Kāinga Ora, ours is the important responsibility of transforming New Zealand's housing choices, outcomes and the entire housing sector by creating homes and communities that allow New Zealanders to thrive.§        § What is exciting about working for Kāinga Ora is getting the chance to make a real and positive impact on New Zealanders' lives. With skills, planning and purposeful action, our people are creating the homes and neighbourhoods that will build Aotearoa's future.We are passionate about transforming New Zealand for the better. That includes being a trusted partner for Māori and iwi, protecting and enabling their rights, interests and aspirations under the guidance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§        §Ko tā mātou mahi - Our Role§        §We are currently recruiting for a change management professional with a working knowledge of the PROSCI methodology to join our Wellington based team.§        §As a Change and Engagement Specialist you will work within a skilled team of professionals. You will be an important member of the Change and Engagement team, and will be responsible for working with project teams to advise on best practice, people-centric change initiatives.§        §To be successful in this role, you will be adept at influencing both managers and staff as you guide them through change. This includes having the courageous conversations that are needed, whilst being the ultimate diplomat. jobText: TXT/50633474.txt	§Policy and Strategy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy and Strategy Manager§§Advertiser: §people&co.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Take your policy career to the next level§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§The Horizons Region extends over 22,200km2 - from Ruapehu in the north and Horowhenua in the south, to Whanganui in the west and Tararua in the east. It's a landscape as rich and varied as the over 240,000 people who call it home. At Horizons Regional Council we work to make our region a great place to live, work and play. §  §We are looking for a Manager Policy and Strategy who can confidently take a leadership role in policy and strategy development and monitoring. You will be skilled in working with councillors, communities and staff to refine policy, lead plan changes and evaluate effectiveness. You will be alert to new strategic opportunities as the region looks to grow its prosperity and sustainably manage its resources. §  §We are looking for an excellent communicator with a strong history of developing enduring and valuable relationships. As the successful applicant, you will have:§ § §A tertiary qualification and several years' experience at a senior level in planning or policy development and monitoring § §Experience working with the Resource Management Act, and knowledge of Treaty Settlement processes§ §Excellent stakeholder management skills § §Strong critical thinking skills.§ §This is a full time role, based in Palmerston North. In return, you'll work for a flexible family friendly organisation, with a strong focus on employee health and well being, within a supportive and social work environment. §  §Applications close at §5pm§ on §Sunday, 18 October 2020§.§  §If you are interested in the position please click the §APPLY NOW§ button.  All applications will be acknowledged electronically.§  §For further information contact §Jacaleen Williams§ on §(04) 931 9450§ or §Michele Walls§ on §(04) 931 9448§ quoting job number §19510§.§  §To be eligible to apply you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand and meet any entry requirements if you're outside the country.  For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa and our entry requirements visit www.immigration.govt.nz§§§§

jobTitle: 20/400 Strategic Investment Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50689275.txt	§20/400 Strategic Investment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/400 Strategic Investment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Type:§ Secondment - 12 months§Hours:§ Full time§Location:§ Wellington§Business Group§: Agency Partnerships and Capability §Branch:§ Digital Public Service§Salary:§ $129,622 - $175,371§§                    §  §Te Tari Taiwhenua/Internal Affairs serves and connects people, communities and government to build a safe, prosperous and respected nation. We deliver value to New Zealanders in many ways – leading digital government, keeping Kiwis safe from harm, supporting strong and resilient communities, strengthening civic participation and governance, and fostering our cultural identity. In other words, we are all about helping to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders.   §Our public service is being called upon to deliver a unified, seamless and effective digital experience so that New Zealanders have the best possible experience of government.§  §  §The Digital Public Service branch achieves this by working across the public service to set system direction, connect, influence and support the system to transform and better respond to the ever-changing digital landscape. It also enables the Government Chief Digital Officer (GCDO) to support a modern adaptive public service with the skills, technology and data to operate at pace in a fast-changing digital environment.§  §  §The branch has recently redefined its purpose and has reorganised to better meet the needs of a digital public service. This role is the result of this redesign.§  §  §Are you an investment specialist looking for a challenging and satisfying new role? We seek people with a deep understanding of how investment supports the achievement of government digital outcomes to join our new team of multidisciplinary consultants.§  §  §Working collaboratively with your colleagues you will act as a ‘change agent’, supporting public sector agencies to develop investment capability to maximise and align their investment to the Strategy for a Digital Public Service.  You will do this by:§  §Being a key liaison between the DPS branch and other central agencies responsible for digital and data investment strategy§Developing a comprehensive understanding of a portfolio of agencies – including their current digital/ICT systems, risks’ and investment and transformation intentions and plans§Providing strategic direction and system outcomes to support agencies to make smart, agile, investment decisions in-line with behaviours in the Strategy for a Digital Public Service§Advising agencies about their investment plans, their responsibilities and accountabilities, and ensuring decisions are in line with published frameworks and guidelines§Supporting the development and maintenance of investment guidelines, information and tools.§§§The ideal candidate will have:§§A strong knowledge and experience of digital and ICT investment and an understanding of latest trends, thinking, frameworks, legislation and public service investment policy and processes§a comprehensive understanding of how digital investment processes influence and enable successful business change§experience managing a portfolio of complex and diverse stakeholders, and using intel gathered to inform strategy development.§§§You will also §Understand and be able to communicate the benefits of and direction necessary to achieve system digital transformation §§be an exceptional communicator and be able to give good, pragmatic advice to senior business leaders with confidence, maturity and intelligence.§§The nature of this role means you may need to have the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. §If you want to join a team of smart, committed people who do some spectacular work for New Zealand – then make sure you get in touch.     §We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§                    §                    §To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Wednesday 21 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Paul Jordan at §Paul.Jordan@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Change Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701766.txt	§Senior Change Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Change Manager§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Senior Change Manager§ §Full time, Permanent§ §Located in Britomart, Auckland§ § §In a world where change is the only constant, we know that the key is to improve the capability of people to adopt, manage and embrace change. The Change Practice at Westpac is an enterprise wide function that enables our people to be ready and able to adopt change so that value is delivered into the hands of our customers.§ § §About the Opportunity:§ § §We currently have a rewarding Senior Change Manager position available, which offers the opportunity to be part of a major transformational project implementing future state processes to ensure compliance with regulatory obligations relating to outsourcing.    § §The Senior Change Manager role will support both simple and complex change initiatives to ensure our people are ready to adopt change, minimise disruption to the business and maximise delivered value.§ § §Key components of the role include: § § §Making upcoming changes visible via the Change Forecast and providing stakeholders with decision support advice§ §Engaging with stakeholders to identify and manage change impacts§ §Building change capability in agile teams and enabling them to self-serve for simple change§ §Directly managing change for high impact / complex initiatives and measuring change effectiveness§ § §The person we’re looking for:§ § §We’re looking for someone with proven Change Management skills and experience and who has held Change Manager positions in large organisations. Ideally, you would have experience and exposure in delivering Risk and regulatory changes in a banking environment. Facilitation is key in this position as are strong influencing skills. Equally, you need to be comfortable presenting to and working with stakeholders at all levels, with the ability to adapt your style to suit the audience. You’ll need to be organised, have an eye for detail and feel at ease juggling multiple priorities. You’ll love working with people and have the perfect balance of empathy, resilience and drive to deliver. Experience in leading a small team of change managers would be ideal.  § § §What you will need to succeed:§ § §5+ years’ recent experience in change management roles, preferably in the Banking / Financial Services sector.§ §Experience delivering change relating to one or more of the following: Complex Risk and Regulatory change programmes, Risk culture or organisational culture development initiatives and data management related programmes in a banking environment.§ §Ideally, direct experience of delivering change in Agile environments and familiarity with the principles of Agile operation. Added bonus if experienced working with human centred design and have experience in adult learning, education and/or training.§ §Familiarity with change management frameworks and techniques (e.g. Prosci, ADKAR, Lean Change), with the ability to adapt and apply.  § §Excellent stakeholder management skills and a collaborative working style and comfortable operating at all levels of the organisation.§ §Proven ability to coach individuals and teams to deliver effective change.§ §Outstanding written and oral communication skills – ability to tell a story.§ §Resilience and an openness to learn and iterate are keys to succeeding in our environment.§ § §What’s great about working for Westpac?§ § §We’re passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we’ll invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your on-going learning and development.  As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme.§ § §Interested?§ §Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter to the link on this page!§ § §We appreciate your interest in a future career with Westpac, however, due to current border restrictions brought about by Covid19 and uncertainty around when this will change, we are unable to support visas for offshore applicants at this time.§§§§§

Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About the business§ § §Xero is a global technology company delivering beautiful cloud accounting. 12 years on the Company has grown and proven to be one of the top 10 growing SaaS technology companies globally.  Xero's growth trajectory relies on setting and executing our product strategy to become the beautiful platform for small business globally.§ § § § §About the role§ §§ § §Develop clear product strategies alongside Product Managers, GMs and EGMs, setting and aligning the product vision and plan§ § §Apply a combination of a classical strategic toolkit alongside modern product practices to drive innovation in objective setting, measuring results and how product solves customer problems to meet those results§ § §Connect product strategies to Xero's company-wide strategy§ § §Work with the commercial product leader to establish world class SaaS capabilities and standard processes for connected commercial and product planning, align regional planning with deliberate geographic expansion, platform portfolio management and value realisation§ § §Be a key contributor to the ongoing definition and evolution of our long-term product strategy, including evaluating the changing landscape in which Xero operates, identifying the most attractive opportunities and ensuring Xero is positioned to win in the future§ § §Be a trusted and respected member of the Product strategy team and a key contributor in other cross-functional teams that require strategic support to explore, evaluate, and recommend strategies and tactics to support Xero's priorities§ § §Help structure and solve business problems, collaborating and coordinating with a range of internal stakeholders to develop recommendations on a wide range of business issues§ § §Develop rigorous, fact based, quantitative analysis to support recommendations.§ § §Develop and support the communication of recommendations to senior management, other executive, functional, or regional management and staff in a clear, concise and impactful way§ § §Support the creation of materials for the Board of Directors and Executive leadership to communicate our perspective on key market trends and strategic implications for Xero§ § § § § §Skills and experience§ §§ § §6 – 10 years of experience in Strategy (or 1-2 years post MBA)§ § §Experience in running strategic projects and managing resources to deliver insightful recommendations that have been implemented and delivered true benefit to the business§ § §Experience in the technology sector and/or product development important and preferred§ § §Extensive experience in teams performing complex cross-enterprise projects with multiple stakeholders at both senior and junior levels§ § § Can quickly establish close working relationships with individuals across all levels§ § §Able to collaborate and coordinate with a range of internal stakeholders, building respect and trust to assist in the development and execution of strategic recommendations§ § §Ability to present a coherent case using clear and concise messaging with supporting analysis and tools § § §Ability to articulate thoughts and ideas in a clear and composed manner through written and verbal communications§ § §High EQ – strong ability to 'read the room' and adjust the approach as appropriate§ § §§§§

Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.§        §KPMG’s Global Infrastructure business is one of the world's leading advisors to the infrastructure sector (www.kpmg.com/infrastructure). jobText: TXT/50673165.txt	§Equipment Management Capability Development Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Equipment Management Capability Development Lead§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §Equipment Management Capability Development Lead §    §      §        §What you will do§        §This is an exciting opportunity for a learning & organisational development specialist to embed, manage and continue to evolve various initiatives that are being implemented within the Defence Equipment Management Organisation (DEMO). This includes a Competency Framework, Learning Solutions Framework, Talent Management System, Position Descriptions and the DEMO Workforce Strategy.§        §You will maintain and coordinate the DEMO induction programme and assist competency subject matter experts in designing, developing and delivering discrete equipment management learning solutions to workforce members. This includes a Competency Framework, Learning Solutions Framework, Talent Management System, Position Descriptions and the DEMO Workforce Strategy.§You will maintain and coordinate the DEMO induction programme and assist competency subject matter experts in designing, developing and delivering discrete equipment management learning solutions to workforce members.
