You will be an effective planner, articulate communicator and most importantly, a commited team player, who is able to positively contribute to the development journey DEMO is undertaking to become an ISO55000-aligned, world class equipment management organisation.§The ideal candidate will:§Be experienced in the development, management and implementation of learning and organisational development solutions;§Possess excellent planning, communication, facilitation, and stakeholder relationship skills;§Be a leader in their field.§Who we are§The Defence Equipment Management Organisation (DEMO) is responsible for providing proactive, responsive and effective strategic in-service equipment fleet management and full life-cycle integrated logistic support (ILS) advice to support delivery of the NZDF's outputs. Our focus is on equipment and related commodities and consumables, and ensuring they are available at the right time and standard to enable the Army, Air Force and Navy to achieve the right effect.§The NZDF is charged with the defence of the nation, the security of its interests, and the protection of its fundamental values and institutions. The NZDF comprises 14,000 military and civilian staff across the armed services of Navy, Army and Air Force, operating as Three Services - One Force.§Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§Great benefits for you and your family§;§5 weeks annual leave per year;§Free onsite parking and great nearby amenities;§Flexible working environment and positive culture;§Variety, challenge and a chance to influence.§How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.For further information, contact Garry Brosnan on §(04) 560 6837§.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Sunday 18 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Low level Security Clearance§most preferably a NZ citizen, who §has resided in this country continuously§ for at least the last §five years§, OR§is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §five years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, the United Kingdom (UK) or the United States of America (USA); § and § has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at this level.§If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Research and Evaluation Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50684651.txt	§Senior Research and Evaluation Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Research and Evaluation Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ § §Enriching Aotearoa with thriving Pacific communities through robust research and evaluation evidence, and insights§ §Connecting with Pacific communities and across government to lead insightful research for better Pacific people outcomes§ §Working collaboratively across Evaluation and Policy work§ § As a Senior researcher in your field - you will be responsible for the delivery of work across Research and Evaluation programmes.  You will bring a Pacific community lens to the research work where experience in research frameworks and methodologies promote positive Pacific outcomes. §  § §Our purpose§ § § The Ministry for Pacific Peoples make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§ § §What you will do in this role is:§ § §working in collaboration with the wider Research and Evaluation team, you will deliver research and evaluation work that feeds into key programmes such as Tupu Aotearoa and Toloa which strengthen the delivery of programmes for Pacific peoples.§ §undertake quantitative and qualitative research that provides accurate data to ensure the delivery of significant research programmes are successful.§ §provide support to the Director Research and Evaluation in the Pacific Data Sovereignty Network – this is key development for Pacific research.§ §provide insightful research for the COVID-19 Pacific recovery package - ensuring the policy development can be targeted for better Pacific outcomes.§ §support and influence in rolling out best practice and processes around the Ministry’s research and evaluation work.§ §support the translation of research into policy – working closely with the Policy team to ensure policy planning and development are informed by robust research evidence and insights.§ §contribute to a key Ministry programme established in Languages research so undertaking significant and ground-breaking research that promotes a wider understanding of Pacific peoples’ views, experience, cultures and languages.§ §providing robust research and evaluation advice which contributes to the Ministry’s reputation as a centre of excellence in Pacific research, ensuring high-quality advice is provided that brings credibility and assurance through building a strong network of stakeholders from across government, not-for-profit, Pacific community groups and industry sectors.§ § §To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § §strong delivery of solid research and evaluation, demonstrating a robustness around research and evaluation methodologies, approaches and outcomes.§ §good network across smaller Pacific ethnic communities that enables collaboration and focus on positive research outcomes for Pacific People.§ §postgraduate qualification and a background in education, preferably in early childhood education and care.§ §excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ §good understanding of the machinery of government and how to navigate it.§ §strong stakeholder engagement skills and the ability to engage with different sectors of the Pacific communities.§ § §Working for us§ § § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, healthcare insurance, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our Lalanga Fou goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand§  § If you would like more information please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 11 October 2020.§ For a copy of the position description, please click on the link below.§ https://www.mpp.govt.nz/assets/Uploads/Senior-Analyst-Research-and-Evaluation.pdf§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50688516.txt	§Senior Operations Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Operations Analyst§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Senior Operations Analyst §    §    §      §        § §        §          §Provide quality assurance and systems analysis advice§          §Bring your view of business and financial systems, metrics and reporting§          §Based in any of the main Waka Kotahi office§        §        § §        §About us | §Ko wai mātou§        §At Waka Kotahi, the NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. You will love working within a fast paced, agile and dynamic work environment, where innovation and calculated risk taking is highly valued, along with the ability to get stuff done.§        §Excellent verbal and written communication is essential, along with strong organisation skills. Previous programme coordination experience in a complex organisation would set you ahead of the pack§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Demonstrated experience working in reporting and analytical roles§          §Experience in information reporting, especially performance related reporting, preferably in an area supporting other teams in making strategic, management and operational decisions§          §Experience with and exposure to Business Intelligence analytics§          §Strong analytical and quality system thinking§          §Skilled at report writing and interpreting data§          §Strong ability to identify and interpret risk and use information to provide evidence for continuous improvement§          §Knowledge and understanding of programme management and coordination, processes, disciplines and governance procedures§          §An ability to understand legislation and its impact on the work of a regulatory orgnisations, for example the Privacy Act, Official Information Act, Coroner's Act, Railways Act§          §Proven ability in relationship management, influencing and facilitation§        §        §      §Qualifications:§        §          § §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§        §        § §        §Applications close | §Rā Katinga : Sunday, 25 Oct 2020§        § §        §Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time§        §For a copy of the position description, please visit: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Provide quality assurance and systems analysis advice§Bring your view of business and financial systems, metrics and reporting§Based in any of the main Waka Kotahi office§§ §§About us | §Ko wai mātou§At Waka Kotahi, the NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. Previous programme coordination experience in a complex organisation would set you ahead of the pack§ §About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§Demonstrated experience working in reporting and analytical roles§Experience in information reporting, especially performance related reporting, preferably in an area supporting other teams in making strategic, management and operational decisions§Experience with and exposure to Business Intelligence analytics§Strong analytical and quality system thinking§Skilled at report writing and interpreting data§Strong ability to identify and interpret risk and use information to provide evidence for continuous improvement§Knowledge and understanding of programme management and coordination, processes, disciplines and governance procedures§An ability to understand legislation and its impact on the work of a regulatory orgnisations, for example the Privacy Act, Official Information Act, Coroner's Act, Railways Act§Proven ability in relationship management, influencing and facilitation§§      §Qualifications:§§ §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§§ §Applications close | §Rā Katinga : Sunday, 25 Oct 2020§ §Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. jobText: TXT/50701649.txt	§Principal Methodologist – Census Methodology§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Methodologist – Census Methodology§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Methodologist – Census Methodology §      §        §          §            §Opportunity available in Wellington or Christchurch §            §About Us | Mō mātou§            §At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment. §            §What we’re looking for | Ngā āhuatanga e hiahiatia ana e Mātou § §            §A highly skilled technical leader with expertise in Census methodology, experience delivering and supporting design and methodology solutions that build on organisational capability. You’ll have a strong customer focus, be comfortable with ambiguity and change, and have sound decision-making ability. §            §We believe in coaching and developing our staff and growing capability for high performance. This requires a certain type of technical leadership. One that focuses on mentoring and coaching technical leads for a long-term gain. In this newly created role, you’ll have the opportunity to help shape how technical leadership will operate in the team and make a significant contribution to the success of the 2023 Census.  §            §Starting salary ranges between $110,000 - $129,000 depending on the successful applicant’s experience  §            §The role | Mō te tūnga §            §            §Census Methodology leads the combined census design and methodology workstream that provides methodology and statistical support services across the programme. You’ll ensure Statistical Methods support for the 2023 Census is co-ordinated and cohesive and meets requirements. You will conceptualise, design, develop and evaluate models and methodologies to ensure statistical integrity, and support implementation and operational activity. The aim is to provide end-to-end methodology cohesion for a design-led Census and quality data for customers and Treaty partners.§            §With a focus on methodology across workstreams, you’ll keep your finger on the pulse throughout the Census Programme and bring a Te Āo Maori lense to the work that we do. Tapping into your inquisitive nature, you’ll have an eye for the smallest details which make the biggest differences and ensure statistical integrity. §            §To hit the ground running we’re looking for you to bring your experience in the following:§            §            §            §              §Supporting technical leads and census methodology teams in methodology design and developmentWorking in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§              §Technical credibility building confidence and trusted relationships.§              §Confident with constructively challenging methodologies and able to navigate ambiguity as you juggle a variety of demands and priorities from strategic partners§              §Work in a strategic partnership with census workstreams to ensure statistical methodologies produce fit for purpose data quality§              §Providing methodology and statistical support services using statistical best practice and delivering advice based on sound research and evidence§              §Working in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§            §          §          §            §What’s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe §            §We place great emphasis on our people’s health, safety and wellbeing and encourage flexible working, whether that be from home or our modern offices. You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work §            §              §Have challenging, varied and interesting work.  §              §Utilize your expertise within a dynamic innovative organisation.  §              §Balanced life and work commitments (37.5 hour working week)  §              §Ability to work in an agile, and flexible manner.   §            §            §How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§            §            §If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. §            §To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3lpg24I into your browser. §            §If you have any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert or the position description, or if you have difficulty with your application please email jobs@stats.govt.nz   §            §Applications close: §Thursday, 15 October 2020 §            §You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job. §            §            §          §        §      §      §      §    §    §Make your career count!§ For further information about working at Stats NZ and a job description please visit our careers site.§      § careers.stats.govt.nz§    §  §§§§Opportunity available in Wellington or Christchurch §About Us | Mō mātou§At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.   §What we’re looking for | Ngā āhuatanga e hiahiatia ana e Mātou §   §A highly skilled technical leader with expertise in Census methodology, experience delivering and supporting design and methodology solutions that build on organisational capability. You’ll have a strong customer focus, be comfortable with ambiguity and change, and have sound decision-making ability.   §We believe in coaching and developing our staff and growing capability for high performance. This requires a certain type of technical leadership. One that focuses on mentoring and coaching technical leads for a long-term gain. In this newly created role, you’ll have the opportunity to help shape how technical leadership will operate in the team and make a significant contribution to the success of the 2023 Census.    §Starting salary ranges between $110,000 - $129,000 depending on the successful applicant’s experience      §The role | Mō te tūnga §  §Census Methodology leads the combined census design and methodology workstream that provides methodology and statistical support services across the programme. You’ll ensure Statistical Methods support for the 2023 Census is co-ordinated and cohesive and meets requirements. You will conceptualise, design, develop and evaluate models and methodologies to ensure statistical integrity, and support implementation and operational activity. The aim is to provide end-to-end methodology cohesion for a design-led Census and quality data for customers and Treaty partners.§With a focus on methodology across workstreams, you’ll keep your finger on the pulse throughout the Census Programme and bring a Te Āo Maori lense to the work that we do. Tapping into your inquisitive nature, you’ll have an eye for the smallest details which make the biggest differences and ensure statistical integrity.   §To hit the ground running we’re looking for you to bring your experience in the following:§§Supporting technical leads and census methodology teams in methodology design and developmentWorking in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§Technical credibility building confidence and trusted relationships.§Confident with constructively challenging methodologies and able to navigate ambiguity as you juggle a variety of demands and priorities from strategic partners§Work in a strategic partnership with census workstreams to ensure statistical methodologies produce fit for purpose data quality§Providing methodology and statistical support services using statistical best practice and delivering advice based on sound research and evidence§Working in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§§What’s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe §We place great emphasis on our people’s health, safety and wellbeing and encourage flexible working, whether that be from home or our modern offices. You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work§  §Have challenging, varied and interesting work. §  §Utilize your expertise within a dynamic innovative organisation. §  §Balanced life and work commitments (37.5 hour working week)    §Ability to work in an agile, and flexible manner.  §§How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§§If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter.§To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3lpg24I into your browser.§If you have any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert or the position description, or if you have difficulty with your application please email jobs@stats.govt.nz  §§Applications close: §Thursday, 15 October 2020§§You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job. §§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50657848.txt	§Principal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§Provide timely, quality advice and support for operational policy, and internal process management in support of leadership team roles in the property delivery functions§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§ About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, creates and supports safe, healthy, inspiring and ICT enabled learning environments. EIS manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, is responsible for the largest payroll in the country, and transports over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§ About the role§Reporting to the Chief Advisor in Wellington, you will support future planning and analysis (looking over the horizon, to support Managers working on day to day matters) in support of the School Property Strategy.§Your key accountabilities will include the following:§Proactively leading the investigation, monitoring (to ensure any implementation activities are completed) and closure of escalated risks and issues. This will include researching and analysing the impact, challenging assumptions or direction where required, and pulling together options/recommendations for next steps or responses to stakeholders. This may also include leading/supporting resolution activities§Supporting senior leaders in the Northern region to develop and deliver projects/strategies, particularly as this relates to roll growth, including personally leading business improvement projects or activities as needed; and§Developing cohesive working relationships and collaboration opportunities with key internal stakeholders to progress projects, promote property delivery's position and strengthen policy and operational ties§About you§You will have a Tertiary qualification in an appropriate field and will also offer:§the ability to take a strategic focus on issues, understand issues within a wider business context, and to develop and implement sound, well-reasoned strategies that achieve the required outcomes§excellent written and verbal communication skills§strong relationship management and engagement skills, and the ability to quickly establish trust and credibility.§If you'd like to bring your skills to a rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§ Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§Applications close midnight on Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50689012.txt	§Senior Operations Adviser - Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Operations Adviser - Performance§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Senior Operations Adviser - Performance §        §          §Senior Operations Adviser - Performance | Verification Services - New Zealand Food Safety§          § §          §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§          §New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high-quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programmes that ensure all relevant regulatory requirements are met.  Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost-effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§          §Some of the services VS provide, include:§          §            §Verification and certification services to ~2000 processing companies (for primary and secondary food producers, storage and transport), including slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§            §Inspecting containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the relevant standards to keep New Zealand free of unwanted and new organisms.§            §Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§            §              §The export meat sector accounts for 80% of Verification Service's activities.§            §          §          § §          §About the role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§          §An opportunity exists for an experienced Senior Adviser/Analyst who understands business performance drivers and can develop and manage a business performance framework that will enhance the quality of information used for decision making within the Directorate.§          §This is a great opportunity to combine your performance reporting, strategic analysis, relationship management and business planning & reporting skills in a role where you can really add value.§          §You'll have a keen eye for spotting trends and be skilled in translating a broad variety of qualitive and quantitative data into meaningful and usable information, providing the leadership team with insights that enhance service delivery performance and support quality business outcomes.§          §You will be provided with broad exposure to overall operations including finance, systems, H&S, HR, cost recovery and productivity and be required to establish a clear understanding of our business initiatives and activities and build a strong rapport with senior stakeholders in order to proactively identify opportunities to improve business performance.§          § §          §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§          §            §Proficient in Power BI or similar business intelligence software.§            §Experienced in the development of business performance indicators to measure organisational objectives in an operational environment.§            §Broad experience communicating and presenting accurate, timely and different types of data and information that is engaging, easy to consume and audience appropriate.§            §Tertiary qualification and relevant experience in a similar position (preferably within government or regulatory environment).§          §          § §          §How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin for a confidential discussion on §04 819 4261§ or email §rosie.slevin@mpi.govt.nz§          §Applications for this role close on Tuesday 20 October 2020§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Senior Operations Adviser - Performance | Verification Services - New Zealand Food Safety§ §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high-quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programmes that ensure all relevant regulatory requirements are met.  Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost-effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§Some of the services VS provide, include:§§Verification and certification services to ~2000 processing companies (for primary and secondary food producers, storage and transport), including slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§Inspecting containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the relevant standards to keep New Zealand free of unwanted and new organisms.§Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§§The export meat sector accounts for 80% of Verification Service's activities.§§ §About the role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§An opportunity exists for an experienced Senior Adviser/Analyst who understands business performance drivers and can develop and manage a business performance framework that will enhance the quality of information used for decision making within the Directorate.§This is a great opportunity to combine your performance reporting, strategic analysis, relationship management and business planning & reporting skills in a role where you can really add value.§You'll have a keen eye for spotting trends and be skilled in translating a broad variety of qualitive and quantitative data into meaningful and usable information, providing the leadership team with insights that enhance service delivery performance and support quality business outcomes.§You will be provided with broad exposure to overall operations including finance, systems, H&S, HR, cost recovery and productivity and be required to establish a clear understanding of our business initiatives and activities and build a strong rapport with senior stakeholders in order to proactively identify opportunities to improve business performance.§ §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§§Proficient in Power BI or similar business intelligence software.§Experienced in the development of business performance indicators to measure organisational objectives in an operational environment.§Broad experience communicating and presenting accurate, timely and different types of data and information that is engaging, easy to consume and audience appropriate.§Tertiary qualification and relevant experience in a similar position (preferably within government or regulatory environment).§§ §How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin for a confidential discussion on §04 819 4261§ or email §rosie.slevin@mpi.govt.nz§§Applications for this role close on Tuesday 20 October 2020§ §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. jobText: TXT/50688460.txt	§Senior Operations Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Operations Analyst§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Senior Operations Analyst §    §    §      §        § §        §          §Provide quality assurance and systems analysis advice§          §Bring your view of business  and financial systems, metrics and reporting§          §Based in any of the main Waka Kotahi office§        §        § §        §About us | §Ko wai mātou§        §At Waka Kotahi, the NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for the Transport Agency and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit §www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§        § §        §The opportunity | §Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §The purpose of this role is to support the Safer Commercial Transport management and wider teams.  This will be achieved by bringing a strong view of the importance of quality systems in business, developing and implementing those systems.  The focus will be on delivering information and analytical insights through business reporting, strategic and tactical analytical advice in relation to our work programme, financial analysis and forecasting.  The work you will do will have a wide context aligned with the regulatory work programme. §        §As a high energy go getter, you will enjoy being at the centre of activity as you play a critical part in ensuring "business health" for the Safer Commercial Transport regulatory function. You will love working within a fast paced, agile and dynamic work environment, where innovation and calculated risk taking is highly valued, along with the ability to get stuff done.§        §Excellent verbal and written communication is essential, along with strong organisation skills. Previous programme coordination experience in a complex organisation would set you ahead of the pack§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Demonstrated experience working in reporting and analytical roles§          §Experience in information reporting, especially performance related reporting, preferably in an area supporting other teams in making strategic, management and operational decisions§          §Experience with and exposure to Business Intelligence analytics§          §Strong analytical and quality system thinking§          §Skilled at report writing and interpreting data§          §Strong ability to identify and interpret risk and use information to provide evidence for continuous improvement§          §Knowledge and understanding of programme management and coordination, processes, disciplines and governance procedures§          §An ability to understand legislation and its impact on the work of a regulatory orgnisations, for example the Privacy Act, Official Information Act, Coroner's Act, Railways Act§          §Proven ability in relationship management, influencing and facilitation§        §        §      §Qualifications:§        §          § §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§        §        § §        §Applications close | §Rā Katinga : Sunday, 25 Oct 2020§        § §        §Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time§        §For a copy of the position description, please visit: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Provide quality assurance and systems analysis advice§Bring your view of business  and financial systems, metrics and reporting§Based in any of the main Waka Kotahi office§§ §§About us | §Ko wai mātou§At Waka Kotahi, the NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for the Transport Agency and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit §www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§§ §§The opportunity | §Te Whiwhinga mahi§The purpose of this role is to support the Safer Commercial Transport management and wider teams.  This will be achieved by bringing a strong view of the importance of quality systems in business, developing and implementing those systems.  The focus will be on delivering information and analytical insights through business reporting, strategic and tactical analytical advice in relation to our work programme, financial analysis and forecasting.  The work you will do will have a wide context aligned with the regulatory work programme. §As a high energy go getter, you will enjoy being at the centre of activity as you play a critical part in ensuring "business health" for the Safer Commercial Transport regulatory function. You will love working within a fast paced, agile and dynamic work environment, where innovation and calculated risk taking is highly valued, along with the ability to get stuff done.§Excellent verbal and written communication is essential, along with strong organisation skills. Previous programme coordination experience in a complex organisation would set you ahead of the pack§ §About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§Demonstrated experience working in reporting and analytical roles§Experience in information reporting, especially performance related reporting, preferably in an area supporting other teams in making strategic, management and operational decisions§Experience with and exposure to Business Intelligence analytics§Strong analytical and quality system thinking§Skilled at report writing and interpreting data§Strong ability to identify and interpret risk and use information to provide evidence for continuous improvement§Knowledge and understanding of programme management and coordination, processes, disciplines and governance procedures§An ability to understand legislation and its impact on the work of a regulatory orgnisations, for example the Privacy Act, Official Information Act, Coroner's Act, Railways Act§Proven ability in relationship management, influencing and facilitation§§      §Qualifications:§§ §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§§ §Applications close | §Rā Katinga : Sunday, 25 Oct 2020§ §Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time§For a copy of the position description, please visit: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§§§§

We aim to remove the road blocks that prevent access  to data to help customers make the best decisions for their businesses.§ §We've been successful in supporting Aotearoa NZ's COVID-19 response, providing critical datasets to pandemic modelling and reporting on how well we behaved during the different alert levels.§ §Our work isn't finished; there's now a focus on how can we measure and monitor the recovery of the economy and wellbeing of Aoteroa New Zealand.§ §The role | Mō te tūnga§ §As Head of Operations, you report to the Executive Director (ED) of Data Ventures, and are second in charge, deputising for the ED when required. This is a critical internally focused role and you'll be responsible for operational strategy, commercial direction and internal systems. There's also an external focus and responsibility to lead data provider relationships, who are key stakeholders to our customers' success.§ §As a senior leader, you're also a key member of the Stats NZ's Senior Leadership team – accountable for planning for our future, demonstrating collective leadership, and delivering agreed outputs to budget that support and achieve our overall strategic intentions.§ §About you | Mōu§ §We're looking for someone with a good understanding of how government agencies work and who enjoys engaging with other leaders to gain mutual benefits. To be successful in this role, you will bring:§ § §Proven operational leadership experience with business planning and forecasting, especially through periods of growth.§ §Experience of brokering value between two parties ensuring on-going and long-term relationships§ §Strong strategic thinking and conceptual skills, sound commercial judgement and well-developed financial management skills§ §Proven relationship, negotiation, interpersonal, coaching and listening skills with the ability to communicate at all levels of an organisation§ §Political nous with the ability to build and maintain trust and confidence of customers and stakeholders (ideally within a government context)§ §What's in it for you | Āwhina§ §You'll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes:§ § §Opportunity to lead a team and generate continued success§ §Interesting and meaningful work that benefits Aotearoa New Zealand§ §Flexible work that supports balancing life and work commitments§ §An inclusive environment where you can be yourself§ §Health and wellbeing support and services§ §How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§ §To view the position description click on or copy and paste this link §https://bit.ly/3l8bnnm§ to your browser.§ §If you are looking for a new challenge and this sounds like you, please apply.§ §Any questions about the role please contact §jobs@stats.govt.nz§ §Applications close 23 October 2020 at 11:55pm and we will be screening and actioning as we receive them so don't delay, apply now. § §You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job§§§§

jobText: TXT/50656257.txt	§Performance and Planning Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Performance and Planning Advisor§§Advertiser: §Rezource Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§Kia hiwa ra!§Te Pūtahitanga o Te Waipounamu is the Whānau Ora Commissioning Agency for the South Island. Te Pūtahitanga o Te Waipounamu works on behalf of the nine Iwi of Te Waipounamu to determine the best ways to support whānau.  The commissioning agency model contributes to realising the power of Whānau Ora by developing strategies based on four guiding principles:§§Kotahitanga - collaborative approach to integrated solutions and delivery§Kāinga focus - local solutions. Whānau initiated solutions are best.§Panoni hou - innovation through investing in new solutions, encouraging social innovation and entrepreneurship to incentivise new services, new approaches and integrated solutions§Kōkiritanga - partnering for success§The purpose of the position is to improve the planning and performance management capabilities as the organisation transforms through a rapid growth phase.  Responsible for designing and implementing improved strategic and operational planning processes, by supporting the senior management team and staff across the organisation to develop robust, measurable workplans through which delivery can be managed and achieved.§An ability to apply a cultural lens to problem-solving and decision-making by bringing together good business practice balanced with an understanding of the kaupapa of the organisation is fundamental.§Responsibilities include:§Facilitate, develop and deliver a strategic long-term plan as part of the annual investment plan.§Foster and develop a planning and performance reporting focus which encourages engagement across Whānau Ora entities and internally within Te Pūtahitanga o Te Waipounamu§Support the Chief Operating Officer by running internal forums to gather performance and planning requirements from workstreams.§Support, maintain and monitor internal monthly and annual planning and performance processes.§Provide performance reports as required by the Pouārahi and senior management team.§Work with team leads/managers to inform the design and development of the performance and planning systems and processes.§Maintain three-year accreditation with Te Wana and the Accreditation Alliance Australia-New Zealand.§You will have:§Exceptional communication skills§Well developed facilitation skills with the ability to present information§Solid track record of development and successful implementation of strategic plans, business plans and performance management reporting§Strong analytical skills §Self-motivated, organised and confident §Competency and confidence in Te Reo Māori me ōna tikanga and a willingness to proactively develop these§§For confidential enquiries, please contact Vanessa Hutchins 027 221 8960 or Chan Collin §0275 401 027§ §Applications close 14th October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: 20/401 Investment Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50689502.txt	§20/401 Investment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/401 Investment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Type:§ Secondment§Hours:§ Full time§Location:§ Wellington§Business Group§: Agency Partnerships and Capability§Branch:§ Digital Public Service§Salary:§ $110,312 - $149,245§                    §Te §Tari Taiwhenua/Internal Affairs serves and connects people, communities and government to build a safe, prosperous and respected nation. We deliver value to New Zealanders in many ways – leading digital government, keeping Kiwis safe from harm, supporting strong and resilient communities, strengthening civic participation and governance, and fostering our cultural identity. In other words, we are all about helping to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders.  §Our public service is being called upon to deliver a unified, seamless and effective digital experience so that New Zealanders have the best possible experience of government.§  §The Digital Public Service branch achieves this by working across the public service to set system direction, connect, influence and support the system to transform and better respond to the ever-changing digital landscape. It also enables the Government Chief Digital Officer (GCDO) to support a modern adaptive public service with the skills, technology and data to operate at pace in a fast-changing digital environment.§  §  §The branch has recently redefined its purpose and has reorganised to better meet the needs of a digital public service. This role is the result of this redesign.§  §  §Are you an investment specialist looking for a challenging and satisfying new role? We seek people with a deep understanding of how investment supports the achievement of government digital outcomes to join our new team of multidisciplinary consultants.§  §  §Working collaboratively with your colleagues you will act as a ‘change agent’, supporting public sector agencies to develop investment capability to maximise and align their investment to the Strategy for a Digital Public Service.  You will do this by:  §  §Developing a comprehensive understanding of a portfolio of agencies – including their current digital/ICT systems, risks’ and investment and transformation intentions and plans§Supporting agencies to make smart, agile, investment decisions to bring digital transformation to the agency in-line with behaviours in the Strategy for a Digital Public Service§Advising agencies about their investment plans, their responsibilities and accountabilities, and ensuring decisions are in line with published frameworks and guidelines§Supporting the development and maintenance of investment guidelines, information and tools.§The ideal candidate will have:§  §A strong knowledge and experience of digital and ICT investment and an understanding of latest trends, thinking and frameworks§a comprehensive understanding of how digital investment processes influence and enable successful business change§experience managing a portfolio of complex and diverse stakeholders, and using intel gathered to inform strategy development.§§You will also be an exceptional communicator and be able to give good, pragmatic advice to senior business leaders with confidence, maturity and intelligence.§The nature of this role means you may need to have the ability to obtain and maintain a Confidential security clearance.§§If you want to join a team of smart, committed people who do some spectacular work for New Zealand – then make sure you get in touch.  §We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Wednesday 21 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Julie Watson at §Julia.Watson@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About the business science skills.§ §You will either have previous experience as an economic consultant or excellent University grades if you are a recent graduate (GPA of 8+).§ §Our work focusses mainly on the Based at Mr Apple in Hawkes Bay you will work for the Scales Group Health & Safety, Compliance and Sustainability Manager and get to work with a diverse company that values its biggest asset its people.  Mr Apple is New Zealand's largest vertically integrated grower, packer and exporter of apples. jobText: TXT/50646047.txt	§Change Management Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Management Lead§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Change Management Lead §      §        §Downer New Zealand is NZ’s leading provider of integrated infrastructure services. The Facilities Services and Utilities (FS&U) division is a provider of end-to-end maintenance and project management services.  We design, construct, operate, maintain and manage assets and systems to deliver great results for asset owners and their customers. Our proven capabilities in high calibre technical asset management, technical facilities management, cleaning, catering, and technical utilities services; the smarts of our more than 8,000 people in all parts of the country; and our well established customer base is the platform for our success and growth.§        §Our FS&U Transformation Programme will streamline our work management lifecycle to achieve standardised, simplified, effective and cost efficient business processes. Our vision is to be the leader in our field by transforming the way we get things done together. We want to be easy to work with, easy to work for, sustainable and highly productive.§        §The Change Management Lead is accountable for developing deployment plans and ensure successful roll out in consultation with senior Operational leaders and functional stakeholders. In this role, you will lead a passionate team providing team leadership, clear and efficient work planning and ensuring day-to-day delivery against deployment plans. The key objectives of the role are to:-§        §          §Champion embedding, refining and leading effective change management processes supporting the implementation of the new FS&U operating model.§          §Support Operational leaders embedding new work management processes and ensure business process compliance through training, communication, analytics, and continuous improvement initiatives.§          §Consultation with internal stakeholders and partners on change management activities, priorities and operational delivery.§          §Ensure clear and early coordination with internal stakeholders on scheduling and delivery against key milestones and financial targets.§          §Develop and consolidate change management related workstream deployment plans and support reporting against those plans.§        §        §The Change Management Lead will support building internal change management capability, refine fit for purpose approaches, and embed effective deployment solutions.  Therefore, to be successful in this challenging role, you will ideally have the following skills and attributes:-§        §          §Experience of 3 – 5 years working for a large organisation in a Project or Change Management capacity, preferable from a large commercial environment.§          §Proven working knowledge and hands-on experience with deployment of contemporary change management principles, methodologies, engagement practices and implementation plans.§          §Financial and commercial acumen along with business transformation experience implementing large-scale significant changes to business process, technology and people.§          §Experience in leading a small high performance team and a clear demonstration of leadership behaviours that empower others.§          §Effective communication and stakeholder management with the ability to influence, constructively challenge and deal effectively with conflict.§          §Ability to work in a complex work environment; deal with ambiguity and across functions.§          §Change Management Certification an advantage.§        §        §A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.     §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573780 to apply.    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered. §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is NZ’s leading provider of integrated infrastructure services. The Facilities Services and Utilities (FS&U) division is a provider of end-to-end maintenance and project management services.  We design, construct, operate, maintain and manage assets and systems to deliver great results for asset owners and their customers. Our proven capabilities in high calibre technical asset management, technical facilities management, cleaning, catering, and technical utilities services; the smarts of our more than 8,000 people in all parts of the country; and our well established customer base is the platform for our success and growth.§Our FS&U Transformation Programme will streamline our work management lifecycle to achieve standardised, simplified, effective and cost efficient business processes. Our vision is to be the leader in our field by transforming the way we get things done together. We want to be easy to work with, easy to work for, sustainable and highly productive.§The Change Management Lead is accountable for developing deployment plans and ensure successful roll out in consultation with senior Operational leaders and functional stakeholders. In this role, you will lead a passionate team providing team leadership, clear and efficient work planning and ensuring day-to-day delivery against deployment plans. The key objectives of the role are to:-§§Champion embedding, refining and leading effective change management processes supporting the implementation of the new FS&U operating model.§Support Operational leaders embedding new work management processes and ensure business process compliance through training, communication, analytics, and continuous improvement initiatives.§Consultation with internal stakeholders and partners on change management activities, priorities and operational delivery.§Ensure clear and early coordination with internal stakeholders on scheduling and delivery against key milestones and financial targets.§Develop and consolidate change management related workstream deployment plans and support reporting against those plans.§§The Change Management Lead will support building internal change management capability, refine fit for purpose approaches, and embed effective deployment solutions.  Therefore, to be successful in this challenging role, you will ideally have the following skills and attributes:-§§Experience of 3 – 5 years working for a large organisation in a Project or Change Management capacity, preferable from a large commercial environment.§Proven working knowledge and hands-on experience with deployment of contemporary change management principles, methodologies, engagement practices and implementation plans.§Financial and commercial acumen along with business transformation experience implementing large-scale significant changes to business process, technology and people.§Experience in leading a small high performance team and a clear demonstration of leadership behaviours that empower others.§Effective communication and stakeholder management with the ability to influence, constructively challenge and deal effectively with conflict.§Ability to work in a complex work environment; deal with ambiguity and across functions.§Change Management Certification an advantage.§§A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.     §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573780 to apply.    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §§Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered. §§§§

To achieve this, we form partnerships with children, families and whānau, iwi, NGOs, and other government agencies and work with our partners to help children thrive.§ §        §Technology and Channels is responsible for the Ministry’s technology strategy, systems and services.  It is an exciting time for the group as we are currently implementing a new operating model so that we can deliver our responsibilities more efficiently.§ §        §Our operating model is founded on three main principles:§        § §        §          §User-centricity is paramount, with a focus on the front-line and the wider sector.§          §We will be cloud-first and asset-light, choosing to buy as-a-service offerings from third party suppliers, rather than own technology assets.§          §Our systems and processes will be agile and enabling, to deliver changes faster, reduce complexity and simplify system interactions.§ §        §        §About the role:§        §As part of our new operating model we will have five dedicated Service Portfolios. You will have experience in cloud-based infrastructure platforms such as Amazon Web Services and software platforms such as SalesForce.§        §Skills and experience:§        §You will have significant experience as a business analyst and delivery lead or project manager in a large organisation as well as leading delivery of modern technology systems in a large, customer focussed environment.§ §        §In addition to this you will have previous experience with the transition from legacy systems to new and modern cloud based solutions, exposure to complex corporate integrations and excellent analysis skills§        §What we offer§        §We offer a dedicated and supportive team, flexible work options and the opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki. §        §How to apply (Test- Please DONOT APPLY)§ §        §Test ONLYEmployees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§ §        §All external applicants including MSD employees please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. jobText: TXT/50647633.txt	§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative §      §      §      §        §          §Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§          §Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§          §Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§        §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§        §We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§        §To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§        §To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§        §Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §        §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§        §The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§        §This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        §Applications close 11th October 2020.§        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§§Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§§Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §How to Apply§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§Applications close 11th October 2020.§If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§
