jobText: TXT/50647662.txt	§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative §      §      §      §        §          §Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§          §Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§          §Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§        §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§        §We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§        §To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§        §To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§        §Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §        §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§        §The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§        §This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        §Applications close 11th October 2020.§        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§§Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§§Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §How to Apply§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§Applications close 11th October 2020.§If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50672732.txt	§Senior Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Senior Analyst - Research and Evaluation - Sector Group, National Office 12 months Fixed Term/Secondment §§Play to your strengths as an R and SAS expert§Be part of an established and successful team§Play a key role in the ground-breaking New Zealand Crime and Victims Survey§Improve services through insights from analysis of data§Varied, challenging and rewarding role§Critical thinking and problem-solving approach§§The Ministry of Justice Sector Group brings together the best of strategy, policy, data analysis, research and evaluation capabilities to inform decision making by justice sector leaders. We support an integrated justice sector to deliver ambitious results, for a safe and just New Zealand.§This role will:§§Oversee the delivery of data from a third party§Lead the delivery of analytical results in different formats as appropriate§Prepare written summaries of research results to effectively and accurately communicate findings§Monitor progress against project milestones and deliverables in accordance with the project/research plan§Document research methods and outputs to accurately record the analytical process§§As a Senior Analyst, you will have:§§A Tertiary degree in a relevant field with a strong quantitative/statistical component§Significant experience analysing survey and administrative data§Strong statistical and quantitative research skills§At least three years' experience using SAS to analyse data§Experience with R would be advantageous§Experience in communicating research results and statistical concepts to a wide range of audiences§Experience of building and maintaining effective relationships and working with external providers§Good understanding of government policy, processes and procedures§Experience or demonstrated knowledge of justice issues (preferably knowledge of both criminal and civil justice)§Ability to work effectively in a team§§Applications close 16 October 2020 and must be made through the Ministry of Justice's careers centre §https://www.justice.govt.nz/about/careers/§You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this role.§Please contact Lyndsey Rothwell for more information on §Lyndsey.Rothwell@justice.govt.nz§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.§§§§

jobTitle: Business Analyst Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50591337.txt	§Business Analyst Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Analyst Consultant§§Advertiser: §Redvespa Consultants Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$90,000 - $124999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Redvespa §are§ facilitators of change§.§  §As consultants in business analysis, we have the experience and empathy it takes to understand where businesses are coming from, where they need to go, and how to take everyone on the journey there.§  §What are we looking for?§  §We are seeking multiple Business Analyst Consultants who will work with us to ensure the best outcome for our clients. §  §At Redvespa you'll thrive on a rewarding range of assignments, all within client sites. We are often involved from the formulation of an idea to the early stages of planning, business case development through to project delivery and implementation.§  §You’ll build relationships on trust, navigate landscapes and politics, simplify and articulate complexities, and empathise with every party involved.§  §We are seeking someone who:  § § § §Looks strategically at business problems and design solutions§  § § §Has a passion for business analysis – whether it’s agile, design thinking, data, architecture, and disruptive technologies§  § § §Determine stakeholder influence and anticipate relationship needs§  § § §Communicate across multiple levels of an organisation§  § § §Deliver on Requirements elicitation & management, Business process mapping, Gap analysis, Risks, User stories, Defining acceptance criteria§  § § §Facilitate great workshops and meetings§  § § §Navigate different project approaches or dance between the business and IT worlds§  § § §Experience in a consulting capacity preferred §  § §How can we help you be the best?  §  §You’ll grow through knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer support, dedicated learning and development, and access to minds and materials. This approach saw us recognised with an Employee Experience award at Humankind’s 2018 EX Awards.§  §Life here is good; out on your own supporting clients, with support from us back home.§  §At Redvespa, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and welcome all applications.  §  §If we need to make specific accommodations in any part of the process, please let us know§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have in a business analyst (BA) role?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of the software development lifecycle?§§§

jobText: TXT/50687296.txt	§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport §    §    §      §        § §        §          §This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§          §It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§          §You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §          §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch (South Island)§        §        § §        §About us | Ko wai mātou§        § At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§        §To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§        §Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand. §        §Being a real-world regulator means:§        §We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§        § §        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§        §We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§        §In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§          §Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§          §Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§          §Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§          §An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §        §        § §        §Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§        § #LI-NZTA§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch (South Island)§§ §About us | Ko wai mātou§§ At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This role has the opportunity of growth into other advisory and consulting work. §We want a person to fit into our team and provide Environmental and Farm Systems advise and services to our growing client base. You will be giving farm systems modelling and environmental service support to Water Strategies clients. §This is a varied role and we encourage you to grow our client base and your capabilities. You will perform analysis, modelling, facilitating and advisory tasks to a range of pastoral, arable and horticultural farmers and other clients using effective and efficient communication and excellent work ethics. §You will bring drive and enthusiasm to combine your experience and knowledge of the agricultural and regulatory sector and skills in farm systems modelling. A relevant tertiary degree and ticket in Advanced certificate in sustainable nutrient management are essential. If you have CNMA Certification and other farm systems modeling experience even better. §Being able to relate to farmers, have great communication skills, not to be afraid to facilitate and lead discussions are attributes we want to use. §Making sure that health and safety is at the core of what you do, our expectation is that your work is trusted and of an exemplary standard. This will ensure all the work involving developing Farm Environment Plans, advising on environmental challenges and opportunities, analysis of nutrient budgets and consenting requirements, modeling farm systems using Overseer and other models and the connection and relationships you develop with clients will be highly  sought after. §The environmental consulting field is a growing and demanding position with great job satisfaction and is recognised as an essential part of the primary industry landscape so here is the opportunity to make an impact and work with a great crew.§Send in your CV and cover letter to convince us to give you this opportunity. Applications close on 15th October§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How many years' experience do you have in environment & planning law?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50633840.txt	§Technical Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Writer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Fixed-term, full-time (one year or two years)§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tēnā koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About the Early Learning and Student Achievement Group§At the heart of the work of the Early Learning and Student Achievement Group is making sure that every day, in every early learning service, kohanga reo, school, and kura, the education workforce and curriculum delivery is world class.§Secondary Tertiary is in the Early Learning and Student Achievement (ELSA) Group. It is responsible for setting the standards of NCEA qualifications that students study when they are at senior secondary school levels.§About this role§You will work within the Production House team which is a new team that is part of the Review of Achievement Standards (RAS) project. The RAS project is a key mechanism for achieving the objectives in the NCEA Change Programme. Through the RAS, NCEA Level 1, 2 and 3 standards will be developed that are consistent with the policy goal of having more foundational learning at NCEA Level 1, with more specialisation at Levels 2-3. There are currently over 1,000 achievement standards across NCEA.§The Production House team works alongside the Senior Secondary team, and other teams, in developing products for the RAS project alongside leaders from the education sector.§You will work alongside teachers and other stakeholders from the education sector to produce new standards and associated products for NCEA. You are responsible for providing technical (written) expertise so that high-quality written products are produced; and undertake analysis.§About you§Just like New Zealand, we want our teams to be diverse. All applicants are encouraged to apply. To be successful in the role, you'll be comfortable with becoming the technical expert in a group setting and key driver of product development behind the scenes in the Ministry, and at times with NZQA (our partner in the project).§Much of your production expertise can be expected to be developed on the job, as it relates to a new function and team being developed in the Ministry.§This would be a good entry position into a high profile government department with a great reputation. Prior experience in the education sector and/or in another government department would be desirable but not essential. Existing technical writers should apply but other people with skillsets like policy analysis should also consider this.§Prior experience in the education sector and/or in another government department would be desirable but not essential. Existing technical writers should apply but other people with skillsets like policy analysis should also consider this.§People who can think conceptually and produce documents to suit client and technical needs would do well in this role. You should be confident at discussing matters, undertaking research, performing analysis and presenting your contributions to small groups both internally in the Ministry and externally as part of the RAS project.§A familiarity with project based methodologies like PRINCE2 would be advantageous but not essential.§We offer the following:§Exciting opportunity to be part of a new team and function as it is built within a leading government department§Opportunities to develop within the team over the course of a major project over the next five years§As training needs are identified the team will receive additional support§The Ministry operates flexible working arrangements meaning that you could be working from home at times§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Maori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§The Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi including working for and with Maori education professionals, teachers; and students, their whanau, hapu and iwi.§To view this position in Te Reo please follow this link: §https://expressonline.haineslink.co.nz/pdfs/663151_JobDesc.pdf§If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§For further information, please contact the responsible Senior Manager: Simon Laube at §simon.laube@education.govt.nz§.§This recruitment process is for the formation of a new team so there are multiple roles to be filled. Please access the job application through the Ministry of Education Careers Centre.§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50592826.txt	§Put Your Wisdom To Work - Business Coach, Board Facilitator, Business Owner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Put Your Wisdom To Work - Business Coach, Board Facilitator, Business Owner§§Advertiser: §The Alternative Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ § §Are you an experienced business person ready to use your accumulated wisdom to help and empower other business owners in our COVID19 world?§  § § §Are you an exceptional leader able to act as a catalyst for change?§  § § §Are you currently employed, recently redundant, or a returning Kiwi ready to reinvent your future?§  § § §If this sounds like you - we should talk.§  § § §  §The Alternative Board is looking for wise, motivated business leaders in the Otago region to deliver our proven package of business owner advisory boards, one-to-one coaching, and our Business Builders’ Blueprint©.§  §As you would expect, our boards and facilitators have been exceptionally busy this year as our members navigate the challenging tides of 2020 – which means we need to expand our services to provide the help, guidance, and support that Otago business owners in the small-to-medium enterprise sector need right now.§  §As a franchise business owner with The Alternative Board, you will have the opportunity to be in business for yourself, but not by yourself – we help and support you so you can help and support our members. Since 1990, we have helped over 20,000 business owners around the world achieve their personal and professional goals through monthly business advisory boards and coaching.§  §If you believe you can help business owners in Otago thrive and grow through uncertain times, we should have a discussion.§  §Find out more about The Alternative Board at §https://bit.ly/wisdomtowork§ and, when you’re ready to talk, click the 'APPLY' button and send your CV with a covering letter that tells us how your wisdom and experience will make a difference.§  § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50688065.txt	§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport §    §    §      §        § §        §          §This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§          §It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§          §You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §          §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch (South Island)§        §        § §        §About us | Ko wai mātou§        § At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§        §To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§        §Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand.§        §Being a real-world regulator means:§        §We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§        § §        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§        §We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§        §In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§          §Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§          §Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§          §Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§          §An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §        §        § §        §Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§        § #LI-NZTA§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch (South Island)§§ §About us | Ko wai mātou§§ At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§ §About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §§ §§Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§ #LI-NZTA§§§§

jobText: TXT/50629758.txt	§Project Manager Pacific Health Equity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager Pacific Health Equity§§Advertiser: §NoRTH - A division of Northern Regional Alliance Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Manager Pacific Health Equity §      §        §        § §He Hononga o te Raki §Northern Regional Alliance §  §Noa'ia, Mauri, Ni Sa Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Tālofa, Kia orana, Mālō e lelei, Mālō nī, Talofa lava, Tēnā koutou katoa and warm Pacific greetings.§ § §Our story§        §Our Northern Region (Auckland and Northland) healthcare leaders are committed to delivering collaborative and innovative change. We have government agreement to our vision for healthcare transformation for the next 20 years. Now we are moving into the next phase; scaling up our collaboration to further improve health services for patients and whānau with a focus on health equity.§  §You can read the Northern Region Long Term Health Plan §§here§  §Greater focus on Pacific health equity is central to this transformation and that’s where this exciting role comes in. This is your opportunity to truly make a difference by leading and supporting this regional mahi. §   §We are looking for an early to mid-career professional with experience influencing and designing better, more equitable outcomes for Pacific. You will be confident taking both lead and support roles in change processes and have strong project management skills. Health sector experience is desirable but not essential as you will work closely with health leaders.§   §We’re looking for someone remarkable. If you think this could be you, apply now. When we find the right person we will close this vacancy.§ § §Our role§        §You will deliver key Pacific health equity projects detailed in our Regional Service Plan. These include:§        §          §Supporting regional Pacific health leadership and advisory groups§          §Reviewing and developing a Pacific health plan §          §Developing a regional Pacific insight framework and population health data§          §Supporting the public health service to develop a Pacific case and contact management system in response to COVID-19§        §        §You will also champion Pacific health equity while working alongside regional networks and projects for; equity-led planned care, cancer care, cardiac care, mental health and workforce development.§  §What you will bring§        §You will be confident working across diverse environments and teams and have good interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to engage with and present ideas and information to a range of audiences is important. It is essential that you are customer and community focussed. You will also bring:§        §          §            §Commitment and understanding of Pacific cultural values, processes and principles §          §          §Basic proficiency in one or more Pacific language§          §Experience within a project and programme environment§          §            §Demonstrable experience in engaging stakeholders and networks and growing collaborative support§          §          §Experience with the Pacific NGO sector would also be useful§          §A tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline§        § §What's in it for you?§        §The competitive remuneration package includes five weeks of annual leave and the flexibility to co-locate part time with DHB Pacific health teams. Join our collaborative, high performing team that is committed to delivering the best health outcomes for the Northern Region§   §Full time, permanent role. Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§  §Please apply online.§ §For a detailed position description email Rachna Sudhakar, HR Manager §Rachna.Sudhakar@nra.health.nz§ §  §For a confidential conversation about this role please contact Kim Arcus, Portfolio Manager §Kim.Arcus@nra.health.nz§ or 021 438 546§   §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § §He Hononga o te Raki §Northern Regional Alliance §  §Noa'ia, Mauri, Ni Sa Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Tālofa, Kia orana, Mālō e lelei, Mālō nī, Talofa lava, Tēnā koutou katoa and warm Pacific greetings.§ § §Our story§ §Our Northern Region (Auckland and Northland) healthcare leaders are committed to delivering collaborative and innovative change. We have government agreement to our vision for healthcare transformation for the next 20 years. Now we are moving into the next phase; scaling up our collaboration to further improve health services for patients and whānau with a focus on health equity.§  §You can read the Northern Region Long Term Health Plan §§here§  §Greater focus on Pacific health equity is central to this transformation and that’s where this exciting role comes in. This is your opportunity to truly make a difference by leading and supporting this regional mahi. §   §We are looking for an early to mid-career professional with experience influencing and designing better, more equitable outcomes for Pacific. You will be confident taking both lead and support roles in change processes and have strong project management skills. Health sector experience is desirable but not essential as you will work closely with health leaders.§   §We’re looking for someone remarkable. If you think this could be you, apply now. When we find the right person we will close this vacancy.§ § §Our role§ §You will deliver key Pacific health equity projects detailed in our Regional Service Plan. These include:§ §Supporting regional Pacific health leadership and advisory groups§ §Reviewing and developing a Pacific health plan § §Developing a regional Pacific insight framework and population health data§ §Supporting the public health service to develop a Pacific case and contact management system in response to COVID-19§ §You will also champion Pacific health equity while working alongside regional networks and projects for; equity-led planned care, cancer care, cardiac care, mental health and workforce development.§  §What you will bring§ §You will be confident working across diverse environments and teams and have good interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to engage with and present ideas and information to a range of audiences is important. It is essential that you are customer and community focussed. You will also bring:§ § §Commitment and understanding of Pacific cultural values, processes and principles § § §Basic proficiency in one or more Pacific language§ §Experience within a project and programme environment§ § §Demonstrable experience in engaging stakeholders and networks and growing collaborative support§ § §Experience with the Pacific NGO sector would also be useful§ §A tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline§ § §What's in it for you?§ §The competitive remuneration package includes five weeks of annual leave and the flexibility to co-locate part time with DHB Pacific health teams. Join our collaborative, high performing team that is committed to delivering the best health outcomes for the Northern Region§   §Full time, permanent role. Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§  §Please apply online.§ §For a detailed position description email Rachna Sudhakar, HR Manager §Rachna.Sudhakar@nra.health.nz§ §  §For a confidential conversation about this role please contact Kim Arcus, Portfolio Manager §Kim.Arcus@nra.health.nz§ or 021 438 546§   §§§§§

jobTitle: Analyst and Senior Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50650062.txt	§Analyst and Senior Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Analyst and Senior Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §Analyst and Senior Analyst §    §      §        §Job Ref: 34765§        §          §Are you passionate about helping New Zealand communities?§          §Your chance to work on some front-page issues§          §Join a demanding and diverse working environment!§          §Permanent and Secondment/Fixed Term roles, Wellington based§        §        §We are seeking an Analyst on a permanent basis and a Senior Analyst Fixed Term/Secondment to June 2021, to join our Safe, Strong Families and Communities team.§        §The Safe, Strong Families and Communities (SSFC) team sits within the Māori, Communities and Partnerships Group at MSD. The current focus of the Safe, Strong Families and Communities group involves MSD’s response to Family Violence, Sexual Violence, and Building Financial Capability across New Zealand.§        §In our work, we make a real and positive difference for communities, through the services we invest in and the support we give.§        §In the role of an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and improving a range of social services for New Zealanders.§        §This is a fast paced position in an achievement focused workplace. We are looking for a broad set of skills within the role of Analyst/Senior Analyst. These roles will provide research, insight and analysis at a national level cross our work programme.§        §Functions within this role include:§        §          §leading projects and/or contributing to work on cross government priorities, including Family Violence§          §identifying and analysing national trends and issues impacting on our work programme§          §providing high quality analysis, advice and reports§          §promoting continuous improvement of services and processes including commissioning.§        §        §We are seeking positive individuals, with relevant experience in social services policy, or NGO environment. Knowledge of Te Ao Maori would be an advantage.§        §To be successful in this position you will need excellent writing skills and the ability to provide evidence-based and balanced analysis. §        §You will need excellent relationship management skills and be able to demonstrate how you build relationships with key government stakeholders and internal ministry staff. This means you are an effective communicator in addition to an excellent relationship manager with a collaborative work ethic and values that align to MSD’s goals.§        §You will also be able to demonstrate your ability to develop practical solutions for complex problems and will have led pieces of work from inception through to implementation with a focus on getting the job done. Experience in service development or the Budget process is also a distinct advantage.§        §You have experience in working constructively with a range of stakeholders and can show how you have mentored colleagues and assisted skill and technical capability development.§        §How to Apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button, complete the online application form and submit your CV and Cover Letter outlining your suitability for this role.§        §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close 5pm Monday, 12 October 2020.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/senior-analyst-ssfc-dec-19.docx§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/analyst-ssfc-sep-2020.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 34765§ § §Are you passionate about helping New Zealand communities?§ §Your chance to work on some front-page issues§ §Join a demanding and diverse working environment!§ §Permanent and Secondment/Fixed Term roles, Wellington based§ §We are seeking an Analyst on a permanent basis and a Senior Analyst Fixed Term/Secondment to June 2021, to join our Safe, Strong Families and Communities team.§  §The Safe, Strong Families and Communities (SSFC) team sits within the Māori, Communities and Partnerships Group at MSD. The current focus of the Safe, Strong Families and Communities group involves MSD’s response to Family Violence, Sexual Violence, and Building Financial Capability across New Zealand.§  §In our work, we make a real and positive difference for communities, through the services we invest in and the support we give.§  §In the role of an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and improving a range of social services for New Zealanders.§  §This is a fast paced position in an achievement focused workplace. We are looking for a broad set of skills within the role of Analyst/Senior Analyst. These roles will provide research, insight and analysis at a national level cross our work programme.§  §Functions within this role include:§ § §leading projects and/or contributing to work on cross government priorities, including Family Violence§ §identifying and analysing national trends and issues impacting on our work programme§ §providing high quality analysis, advice and reports§ §promoting continuous improvement of services and processes including commissioning.§ §We are seeking positive individuals, with relevant experience in social services policy, or NGO environment. Knowledge of Te Ao Maori would be an advantage.§  §To be successful in this position you will need excellent writing skills and the ability to provide evidence-based and balanced analysis. §  §You will need excellent relationship management skills and be able to demonstrate how you build relationships with key government stakeholders and internal ministry staff. This means you are an effective communicator in addition to an excellent relationship manager with a collaborative work ethic and values that align to MSD’s goals.§  §You will also be able to demonstrate your ability to develop practical solutions for complex problems and will have led pieces of work from inception through to implementation with a focus on getting the job done. Experience in service development or the Budget process is also a distinct advantage.§  §You have experience in working constructively with a range of stakeholders and can show how you have mentored colleagues and assisted skill and technical capability development.§  §How to Apply§  §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button, complete the online application form and submit your CV and Cover Letter outlining your suitability for this role.§  §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§  §Applications close 5pm Monday, 12 October 2020.§  §Position Description§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/senior-analyst-ssfc-dec-19.docx§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/analyst-ssfc-sep-2020.docx§  §Joining us§  §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§  §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§        §We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§        §In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. You will have deep experience in all aspects of business change management, having worked in the change profession / discipline over several years, ideally experienced in transformational change. This is a strategic change leadership and management role, you will have the ability to think and work strategically and display evidence of whole-of-system thinking and successful change management outcomes over your career, building organisational change maturity and capability. You will have executive presence / mana / credibility and political acumen, being able to influence and coach senior leaders in leading change effectively. You will have a track record in creating and leading high-performing teams, you will be building a cohesive and high performing team of change practitioners, lifting capability in both technical change management skills and soft skills and ensuring quality work is being produced. §          §To apply for this position, hit the Apply Now button or visit www.h2r.co.nz and refer to vacancy no. 26339. jobText: TXT/50639967.txt	§Senior Adviser §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Adviser §§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Senior Adviser §        §          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi §          §With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper§          § §          §Mō te Tiakitanga Putaiao Aotearoa§          §Our biosecurity system protects New Zealand from pests and diseases that would harm our economy, environment, and way of life. We have been very successful in protecting New Zealand from incursions of almost all pests and diseases that could cause significant harm. We can be proud of what we achieve every day. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing import pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. We also play an important role in enabling two-way trade to benefit consumers and the economy. §          §Biosecurity New Zealand is making changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue to protect New Zealand while supporting strong trade and economic growth in an increasingly uncertain world.  §As a result, we have several new positions in Biosecurity New Zealand§, §including Senior Advisers Governance and Assurance. §          §Mō tō mātou rōpū (About our team):§          §The Biosecurity Strategy and Governance Directorate's primary responsibility is to support the Deputy Director-General with effective strategy, governance and assurance, by providing high quality timely advice.§          §Te whainga poto o tēnei tūranga (What is the purpose of this position?):§          §The purpose of these roles is to support the DDG and the Biosecurity New Zealand leadership team to:§          §            §Ensure all Governance and Assurance activity within Biosecurity New Zealand is consistent with MPI systems of Governance and aligns with best practice§            §Provide assurance and advice on the performance of Biosecurity systems of governance, risk and control through the creation and implementation of high-quality reviews, assessments and audits§            §Develop and manage frameworks for risk, Health & Safety and Assurance within Biosecurity New Zealand§            §Develop and manage the frameworks for branch reporting activities and branch performance measurements.§          §          § §          §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako (Skills & Experience):§          §            §Relevant experience preferably across a range of organisations/ industries§            §Matured understanding of the public sector and the machinery of government§            §Extensive experience that involves provision of advice, analysis, internal consultation and engagement, and interaction with senior decision makers§            §Have a sound understanding of how a business works, its core components, and how these fit together to efficiently and effectively deliver its core products or services to meet customers/stakeholders requirements§          §          §If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application. §          §Ahurea - (Culture):§          §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.§          § §          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§          § §          §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - (Benefits of working at MPI):§          §            §Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§            §Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§            §Wellness benefit for employees§          §          §Further information around the benefits of working for MPI can be watched§ here§          §Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.§          §The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visit §http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearance§ for more information.§          §For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email §jolene.ingram@mpi.govt.nz§  §          § §          §Applications close 12 October 2020§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§          § §          § §        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi §§With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper§§ §§Mō te Tiakitanga Putaiao Aotearoa§Our biosecurity system protects New Zealand from pests and diseases that would harm our economy, environment, and way of life. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing import pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. We also play an important role in enabling two-way trade to benefit consumers and the economy. §Biosecurity New Zealand is making changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue measurements.§§ §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako (Skills & Experience):§§Relevant experience preferably across a range of organisations/ industries§Matured understanding of the public sector and the machinery of government§Extensive experience that involves provision of advice, analysis, internal consultation and engagement, and interaction with senior decision makers§Have a sound understanding sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application. §Ahurea - (Culture):§We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. jobText: TXT/50671023.txt	§Principal Workforce Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Workforce Planner§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$93746 - $115803 including 4% super contriubution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§What you will do§You'll be responsible for the development, articulation and maintenance of workforce strategy and work programme, that aligns with the overarching NZDF strategic intent and personnel requirements, contributing to the overall NZDF workforce strategy.§You’ll support strategic workforce planning leadership in facilitating end-to-end strategic workforce planning approach including:§Conducting environmental scanning;§Workforce segmentation;§Supply and demand analysis;§Scenario planning and gap analysis; and§The monitoring of critical workforce segments.§You’ll also facilitate the development and monitoring of personnel costs within NZDF, to help to identify internal and external workforce factors that could affect growth, translating these into business priorities to influence HR programmes and initiative priorities.§What we need§A respected and influential leader with experience contributing to high level strategic planning. You will have exceptional analytical skills and the ability to translate raw data into information and knowledge through the use of dashboards, data visualization and reports, as well as having the ability to interpret, synthesise and convey meaning from data. §You’ll be skilled at critically analysing complex quantitative/qualitative data and translating the findings into easy to understand presentations, as well as making effective recommendations, as well as:§Have experience working across strategic workforce planning activities;§Be able to find constructive pathways through varied, conflicting and diverse viewpoints and needs;§Have strong skills in stakeholder management and communication as well as logical, investigative, evaluative, and adaptive thinking skills;  §Knowledge and understanding of the public sector;§Experience in making strategic level decisions;§Proven experience in leading, managing and successfully implementing projects; and §A relevant tertiary qualification in business or project management. §Who we are§Enhancement of combat capability is dependent on the management of a sustainable workforce. NZDF leaders are expected to manage their workforce resource and make informed workforce decisions to achieve NZDF priorities.§To do so they must be supported by strategic workforce planning, excellent people analytics, reporting and insights enabling them to balance their short term priorities with their ongoing responsibility to steward the workforce for the future.§The Workforce Planning, Systems and AnalyticsUnit is responsible for providing this support by developing and integrating workforce strategy and supporting HR plans and initiatives for the overall NZDF effect of generating a sustainable workforce.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand. As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§Great benefits for you and your family§;§5 weeks annual leave per year;§Variety, challenge and a chance to influence;§Flexible working environment and positive culture.§How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Andre Davies on 021 954 043.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Sunday 18 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for.§The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

As a member of the Analytics and Reporting team, you can expect to work in a supportive and highly collaborative environment where there is a genuine commitment to develop our capability and improve service delivery for our customers.§Working at ACC§We know that a diverse and inclusive team helps us meet the needs of our customers, and we welcome applications from people of every ethnicity, national origin, gender orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, and/or status as an individual with a disability. jobText: TXT/50616115.txt	§Economic Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Populous People§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§This newly created role reflects Napier City Council’s determination to see Napier thrive and prosper right across its community. We are looking for an astute commercial thinker with a strong mix of engagement and analytical skills to analyse, determine and report on the pulse of economic activity and commercial opportunities for Napier.§ § §Reporting to the Director of City Strategy, this Economic Development Manger role will help underpin future business growth in Napier and the city surrounds. You will be working with a wide base of stakeholders, including other economic development partners and managers throughout the region, as well as Napier City Council’s research and data partners. This is a key partnership role that will see you involved in a wide range of initiatives. Your purpose here will be to take the lead role in economic research projects, creating industry overviews, and helping ensure the delivery of customised analytics for businesses interested in further growing or establishing operations in Napier.§ § §We are looking for someone with a strong commercial orientation. You must be tertiary qualified and understand how businesses tick, and you must have a brain that enables you to analyse and assess at the granular level.  A critical element of the role will be the ability to translate data and research into compelling presentations, interactive dashboards, and effective marketing materials. You will be someone who is able to connect to the business leaders and influencers, build relationships and then dive deep into the research and data analysis.§ § §This is all about ensuring the ongoing vibrancy and further development of Napier. If you have the commercial drive and analytical bent, and you feel philosophically aligned to the idea that your work will be all about being a conduit in this local economy then please apply through this seek.co.nz portal.§ § §If you would like to learn more before submitting your application, please telephone Rachel Cornwall on §0272 565620§ to learn more.  § § §Please note, only candidates who are have full NZ working rights will be eligible for this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50631776.txt	§Senior Public Health Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Public Health Analyst§§Advertiser: §people&co.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Quantitative Analyst role within Public Health§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§ §Quantitative analyst § §Public Health insights § §Six month opportunity - immediate start§ §I'm seeking a Quantitative Analyst to provide insight and intelligence leadership in a busy and topical environment. §  §You'll be producing robust public health intelligence information to support planning, delivery and evaluation of public health action, and while operating in this Covid environment, you'll be involved with the intelligence work stream of the ongoing Covid-19 planning and response. §  §While you need to be able to interpret data and produce reports - you'll need to provide robust, big picture thinking, and insights - such as what are the implications from this information, or from changes to the trend? What's more, you'll also need to be able to identify and/or design the systems and processes that need to be in place to provide the information needed to support this. You'll provide direction to a Qualitative Analyst, and play a key part in intelligence leadership. §  §To be successful in this role,  you will need: § § §A strength in quantitative analysis § §Experience in mixed method analytical projects § §Excellent stakeholder relationship skills § §Excellent communication skills § §Public health experience § §Strong competence in a range of analysis software § §Leadership skills   § §A strong team attitude, agility and flexibility.§ §Experience as a Health Insights Analyst would be ideal. §  §Given this role is in the public health environment,  you'll need to possess a high degree of agility to work within an interesting yet rapidly changing environment. The role has an immediate start, is for six months with the possibility of extension, and those looking for a four day week can be considered.§  §If this sounds like an opportunity for you, please don't delay and click the §APPLY NOW§ button.  All applications will be acknowledged electronically.§  §For further information contact§ Jacaleen Williams§ on §(04) 931 9450§ quoting job number §19513.§  §To be eligible to apply you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand and meet any entry requirements if you're outside the country.  For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa and our entry requirements visit www.immigration.govt.nz § §§§§
