jobText: TXT/50574410.txt	§SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY LEAD§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY LEAD§§Advertiser: §Pohlen Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Lead and deliver world-class social and community initiatives for a significant New Zealand business.§  § §Overview§ §Kiwi Property is a leader in their industry and a New Zealand success story. With a sustainability focus 16 years strong, the team are the lively, enthusiastic and the best in the business. They constantly push the boundaries to achieve great results and are seeking an equally motivated social sustainability expert to collaboratively deliver on strategies. This role needs broad expertise to move forward their sustainable practices, with a specific focus within social sustainability practices.§ § §Position§ §Reporting to the National Facilities Manager, this role is responsible for supporting the leadership team in implementing initiatives through the collaborative engagement of key stakeholders. Building on an already strong culture of sustainability, this requires someone who can enable the wider team to implement projects which align to the long-term strategies already in place. Whilst a tactical role, involvement in ongoing strategic planning will require working with the leadership team to ensure future initiatives are integrated into the business plans. Key to this role is the command of sustainability reviews, reporting and internal audits, embedding and executing within the frameworks of GRI, TCFD and CDP standards. The business is a result focused and has a fast-paced environment, where initiatives reflect global trends and industry changes to develop on their current state. § § §Person§ You bring substantial knowledge and experience in leading and delivering world class social sustainability projects in complex businesses. Your exceptional interpersonal skills, including effective relationship building, will allow you to influence with ease creating successful partnerships internally and externally. With the ability to drive important projects and outcomes, you will be motivated by contributing to positive change in our community.§    §Career Opportunity§This position offers a stimulating career opportunity for a sustainability leader to influence a diverse, sizeable, and growing business making a huge impact on the future of sustainability in New Zealand.§ § §To apply send your application directly to us, via the application link.§   § §Your application may be discussed with our client unless otherwise requested.§ Applicants should be in New Zealand and hold a current work visa / residency or NZ citizenship.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50543826.txt	§Strategy & Business Design - Associate Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategy & Business Design - Associate Director§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ §Join an award-winning global consulting and implementation practice§ §Rapidly build your career alongside high-performing people§ §Be a trusted advisor to some of New Zealand’s most interesting clients§ § § §What will your typical day look like?§ §As an Associate Director within our Strategy and Business Design team you will play an active role in leading and coaching talented project teams, working on some of our client’s most complex and pressing issues.§ §You will be working with client executives across a wide range of exciting organisations as a trusted advisor to address their challenges and bring innovative solutions to their most difficult strategic issues. Working collaboratively is a core value practiced every day.§ §You will be responsible for managing engagements, providing our clients with the insights and solutions they need to grow, improve performance and create sustainable competitive advantage. You will help clients take advantage of the many opportunities to be digitally enabled and impactful on the local and world stage.§ §As well as guiding your team on the day to day delivery of outcomes for clients, you will also contribute commercially by developing deep client relationships, identifying opportunities and selling additional client work.§ §The broad nature of our client base means you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a range of industries and sectors, and a broad spectrum of complex challenges. We are committed to learning and development, and Directors and Partners will support your development and provide coaching, guidance and direction.§ §We are a fun, caring and inclusive team who value people’s individual aspirations and connection to our purpose – to make an impact that matters.§ §You are someone with:§ § §8+ years demonstrated experience, managing and delivering strategy development and execution, ideally with significant experience working in a Consulting environment.§ §Experience in developing and executing corporate and business unit strategy§ §Experience in developing and driving growth and digital strategies or transformations, or in M&A strategy and corporate development including post-merger integrations and separations§ §Ability to understand client issues and pull together the right cross-functional team to meet these challenges head-on.§ §Experience and passion for directing, developing and mentoring a diverse and inclusive team, you enjoy seeing newer practitioners grow and develop.§ §Strong quantitative and analysis skills, able to uncover the heart of problems, identify root causes, offer clear solutions and drive change.§ §Ability to communicate, present and contextualise complex ideas concisely and accurately while adjusting style and tone to suit your audience.§ §Proven business development experience, from lead generation and leading bid management through to the delivery of client engagements.§ §The opportunity:§ § §If you have what it takes as a consulting professional, leader and practice-builder, we can promise opportunities to grow your career in a culture that develops, challenges, innovates and inspires.§ §We will offer you training and career development that keeps our consulting team at the top of its game. You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, city car park, healthcare, bonus and a range of Associate Director benefits that you would expect from one of the world's leading professional services brands.§ §About the team:§ § §We are a rapidly growing team based in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. We are currently looking for talented people to join our Auckland office. Our people have widely varied backgrounds but are united by a passion for creating a lasting impact for our clients.§ §At Deloitte, the success of our business is founded on recruiting the best people who share our values and relish the opportunity to embrace change, making a difference on every engagement.§ §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture, and we are investing in growing the representation of women, LGBTQ+, Māori and Pacific people in our leadership roles. § §Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§ §Please note: you must be based and legally entitled to work in New Zealand from the time of application to be considered.§ §If you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Gracie Wang from the People & Performance team on §093030775§. We would love to hear from you!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50605593.txt	§Principal Planner, Tauranga§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Planner, Tauranga§§Advertiser: §WSP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Planner, Tauranga §    §    §      §        §WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§Needed is a Principal Planner for our busy Tauranga office, to assist our clients in creating what matters for future generations. The successful candidate will build on the future ready insights work that WSP has already completed locally, which helps us to better understand our clients and communities. §You will deliver principal level planning and engagement services to a high standard on projects of local, regional and national significance, and contribute to thought leadership in spatial planning and integrated land use and infrastructure provision. In addition, you will provide technical leadership across the core areas of statutory planning under the Resource Management Act, improving the technical health of the planning discipline across the business. §This is an exciting opportunity to take on a varied and challenging role in a fantastic location. Tauranga means ‘the place of rest or anchorage,’ and along with the surrounding Western Bay of Plenty sub-region has experienced significant growth in recent years.  Tauranga offers cosmopolitan city living right on the water’s edge, and is the ideal spot for those who love the outdoors and value a work-life balance. Enjoy beach walks, fishing, surfing, golf, cycling, great dining options, international businesses setting up shop, great shopping, and more.§Skills and Experience:§•    A tertiary qualification in planning, resource management, or environmental science is essential. §•    10+ years’ professional experience in planning or related environmental field.§•    An additional post-graduate qualification in a relevant field is also preferred.§•    Membership or certification by NZPI, EIANZ, CEnvP, IAP2 and/or similar professional body is essential.  §•    Current Drivers Licence.§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. Are you ready to be part of WSP? §For further information, please view the position description. To apply, just follow the link and apply online.§WSP recognises and values the range of characteristics that make people unique, and do this in an environment that celebrates individual and collective achievement. We believe embracing diversity and inclusion delivers positive experiences for people and clients.§He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.§What is the most important thing in the world? At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§Needed is a Principal Planner for our busy Tauranga office, to assist our clients in creating what matters for future generations. jobText: TXT/50638787.txt	§Asset Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Planner§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Asset Planner §        §          §An exciting opportunity has become available within the Department of Conservation's (DOC) Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki Operations Planning team for an Asset Planner looking for a rewarding career contributing to the management of New Zealand's recreational and historic resources.  This is an exciting time to join DOC and grow your career within a highly experienced and motivated team environment.§          §The Department is blessed with more than 72,000 recreational, historic and infrastructure assets - everything from huts and other buildings, signage and interpretation, tracks and walkways, bridges and structures, to campgrounds and toilets.  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.§          §This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §DOC's Asset Planners play a critical role in ensuring we maximise the use of our investments by helping to establish long-term maintenance programmes and advising on monthly work planning with Rangers.  They also provide information to different levels of management, and work as a team of Asset Planners to assist with achieving national consistency.§          §As one of two Asset Planners in the Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, you will be a key member of the Operations Planning team.§          §In this role, you will:§          §            §Develop and maintain the AMIS database for Recreational and Historic work programmes across the districts§            §Ensure accurate reflection of the status of assets and work completed§            §Support district staff to schedule work within the asset management tool§            §Assign work orders to work groups or individuals§            §Maintain equipment master data§            §Be responsible for ensuring work management systems are kept up to date, while working with district Operations teams to develop and prioritise work programmes§            §Manage the Department's asset information system to provide quality analysis and reports for decision-making§            §Carry out all planned work to a high standard, on time and within budget§          §          §The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whānau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region.  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset/Maintenance Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers.§          §This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our district offices on a regular basis (Coromandel, Hauraki, Waikato, Maniapoto and Taranaki).  Good communication skills are essential to successfully build quality relationships with staff in the districts.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §The ideal applicant will have Asset Planning experience or be skilled at managing computer-based management information systems.  They will ideally understand general asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk for visitors.§          § §          §The successful applicant will have:§          §            §An understanding of asset/work management principles, practices and systems§            §A proven ability to manage and analyse data to identify risk and provide quality assurance§            §Excellent interpersonal, communication, engagement and relationship management skills§            §The ability to plan and organise work and resources over a programme of work to meet timeframes§          §          §An understanding of capital assets and operational budget management is desirable.  A good knowledge of the facilities used within the recreation/tourism industry and knowledge of construction principles would also be advantageous.§          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §If you love managing and analysing data sets, and have an active interest in outdoor recreation, then this may well be the role for you.  If you are risk aware and motivated by working with others to achieve common goals, then we would love to hear from you.§          §This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiries, please contact Sarah Carter, §sacarter@doc.govt.nz§, ph 027 260 6115, quoting vacancy 400/9487. §          §Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 12 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity has become available within the Department of Conservation's (DOC) Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki Operations Planning team for an Asset Planner looking for a rewarding career contributing to the management of New Zealand's recreational and historic resources.  This is an exciting time to join DOC and grow your career within a highly experienced and motivated team environment.§The Department is blessed with more than 72,000 recreational, historic and infrastructure assets - everything from huts and other buildings, signage and interpretation, tracks and walkways, bridges and structures, to campgrounds and toilets.  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.§This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.§ §§He angitūtanga: About the Role§DOC's Asset Planners play a critical role in ensuring we maximise the use of our investments by helping to establish long-term maintenance programmes and advising on monthly work planning with Rangers.  They also provide information to different levels of management, and work as a team of Asset Planners to assist with achieving national consistency.§As one of two Asset Planners in the Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, you will be a key member of the Operations Planning team.§In this role, you will:§§Develop and maintain the AMIS database for Recreational and Historic work programmes across the districts§Ensure accurate reflection of the status of assets and work completed§Support district staff to schedule work within the asset management tool§Assign work orders to work groups or individuals§Maintain equipment master data§Be responsible for ensuring work management systems are kept up to date, while working with district Operations teams to develop and prioritise work programmes§Manage the Department's asset information system to provide quality analysis and reports for decision-making§Carry out all planned work to a high standard, on time and within budget§§The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whānau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region.  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset/Maintenance Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers.§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our district offices on a regular basis (Coromandel, Hauraki, Waikato, Maniapoto and Taranaki).  Good communication skills are essential to successfully build quality relationships with staff in the districts.§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§The ideal applicant will have Asset Planning experience or be skilled at managing computer-based management information systems.  They will ideally understand general asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk for visitors.§ §The successful applicant will have:§§An understanding of asset/work management principles, practices and systems§A proven ability to manage and analyse data to identify risk and provide quality assurance§Excellent interpersonal, communication, engagement and relationship management skills§The ability to plan and organise work and resources over a programme of work to meet timeframes§§An understanding of capital assets and operational budget management is desirable.  A good knowledge of the facilities used within the recreation/tourism industry and knowledge of construction principles would also be advantageous.§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§If you love managing and analysing data sets, and have an active interest in outdoor recreation, then this may well be the role for you.  If you are risk aware and motivated by working with others to achieve common goals, then we would love to hear from you.§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiries, please contact Sarah Carter, §sacarter@doc.govt.nz§, ph 027 260 6115, quoting vacancy 400/9487. §Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 12 October 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§§§§

We're really looking for someone who has great coaching skills (can help self-service), who can coach and provide suitable collateral, learning aids to enable people to help themselves and enable change in the future.§An average week would see you immersed in the squads, participate in ceremonies, building relationships with key people in the delivery sides, dealing with other change managers, internal units and the people who will service the customers.§Personal Attributes§        §          §Proactive§          §Resilient and open to learning / iterating  §          §Collaborative – love to work in team and co-problem solve §          §People oriented - care and empathy§          §Smart thinking and ability to analyse/ problem solve§        § §Skills§        §          §Relational skills – stakeholder engagement and management including influencing and being assertive (to challenge constructively when required) §          §Facilitation skills - able to help a group to work through an topic for discussion/problem and move them towards an outcome/solution§          §Gets things done: Organised/ Able to prioritise / adaptability and ability to pivot with nimbleness across 'different worlds'§          §Ability to manage multiple (often conflicting) demands and prioritise work§          §Coaching skills - to help people self-serve and to help them develop capability§        § You'll join an organisation on the cutting edge of digital transformation, stepping up in agile, cross functional teams working collaboratively who are working better and faster to meet the needs of their customers. It's an opportunity for you to put your stamp on what the future might look like as well as joining a team that is looking to raise the level of change management to an international level, so lots to learn and grow with.§      §      §Stephen§0224643644§ §    §  §§§We're looking for a §Change Manager§ with §banking experience§ to take an exciting permanent position within a large bank based in the CBD. §You will be supporting the receivers of change coming from the delivery engine working on product and process change. §We're looking for someone who has worked in an §agile§ environment and come from the §banking§ world.§We're looking for someone who is a change manager through and through and has worked exclusively in change management roles in the past, someone who is extremely good at their craft but not too concerned with doing it their own way, someone who is open to feedback and learning, §very collaborative§ and happy to co-create with stakeholders. We're really looking for someone who has great coaching skills (can help self-service), who can coach and provide suitable collateral, learning aids to enable people to help themselves and enable change in the future.§An average week would see you immersed in the squads, participate in ceremonies, building relationships with key people in the delivery sides, dealing with other change managers, internal units and the people who will service the customers.§Personal Attributes§ § §Proactive§ §Resilient and open to learning / iterating  § §Collaborative – love to work in team and co-problem solve § §People oriented - care and empathy§ §Smart thinking and ability to analyse/ problem solve§ § §Skills§ § §Relational skills – stakeholder engagement and management including influencing and being assertive (to challenge constructively when required) § §Facilitation skills - able to help a group to work through an topic for discussion/problem and move them towards an outcome/solution§ §Gets things done: Organised/ Able to prioritise / adaptability and ability to pivot with nimbleness across 'different worlds'§ §Ability to manage multiple (often conflicting) demands and prioritise work§ §Coaching skills - to help people self-serve and to help them develop capability§ § You'll join an organisation on the cutting edge of digital transformation, stepping up in agile, cross functional teams working collaboratively who are working better and faster to meet the needs of their customers. It's an opportunity for you to put your stamp on what the future might look like as well as joining a team that is looking to raise the level of change management to an international level, so lots to learn and grow with.§§§§

This really is a social programme with a difference!§          §The Service and System Design team works hand in hand with the Tāmaki community for a better future. You will draw from your frontline experience (e.g. practitioner, researcher, advocate) along with your understanding of the structural and systemic conditions that maintain disadvantage in communities like Tamaki to coach and support others to identify opportunities for change. You will be creative and tenacious pulling together partners to prototype, test and implement solutions.  § §To be considered for this position you will have the following attributes:§ § §Empathy§ §Cultural awareness§ §Be comfortable working with ambiguity and open to change§ §Big picture focused§ §Collaborative style and a team player§ §Ideally experience working in social services, mental health services or similar§ §We would especially love to hear from people who have a strong connection to Tāmaki, through experience living / working in the area, and a passion for achieving positive change.§ §If this sounds like an exciting opportunity for you then do not hesitate to get in touch. We are a team of highly skilled resource consent specialists, and at any one time we have a diverse portfolio of clients, projects and consenting problems to solve. §We are hunting for an experienced planner to join our boutique business so we can continue to provide exceptional and expert planning services to our large group of wonderful nationwide clients. §This is a great chance to take your planning career to the next level, with opportunities for management and shareholding for the right person, and flexible working hours.  The right person needs to demonstrate confidence, passion for the job and should sincerely want to make a difference for our clients and for our community.  §You must be able to work with pace and efficiency, as well as understand the demands and risks of the development industry. §        We are looking for that perfect fit, for that person who                      can lead, who can listen and who can manage.§You can find out more about the role, key responsibilities and benefits on our website: www.feathers.co.nz/about/in-the-news§Closing date for applications is Friday 23rd October 2020.§For further information, a detailed position description or to apply with a covering letter and CV, please email Jodi Gowers at §admin@feathers.co.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/41269120.txt	§Planning Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Planning Team Leader§§Advertiser: §BTW Company Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Planning Team Leader §      §        §Is Planning and Leadership your thing?§        §Do you have the experience, expertise and drive to inspire, grow and lead a close-knit team of Planners?§        §BTW Company has a rare opportunity for a talented Planning Team Leader to join our team in Hamilton to focus on leadership, strategy, project management and business development.§        §Operating since 1973, BTW is an innovative, solutions-focused group of Planners, Surveyors, Engineers, Environmental Scientists, UAV pilots, 3D Scanning Specialists, and Land and GIS experts. BTW’s multidisciplinary teams operate from offices in New Plymouth and Hamilton.§        §In this role, you will become a core member of the BTW Team. jobText: TXT/50632118.txt	§Manager Safer Vehicles - South Island §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Safer Vehicles - South Island §§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Manager Safer Vehicles - South Island §    §    §      §        § §        §          §Manage and set the strategic direction of your team in the South Island§          §Lead your compliance focussed team and make a difference to safety on our NZ roads§          §Use your relationship and influencing skills to ensure consistently high quality regulatory services from our providers§          §Based in Christchurch§        §        § §        §About us | §Ko wai mātou§        §At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. Waka Kotahi has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit §www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§        § §        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §As the Manager Safer Vehicles, you will lead the team that delivers Safer Vehicles regulatory activities in the South Island.  You will grow a strong safety and compliance culture within the vehicle certification industry, leading investigations of incidents, alleged breaches and complaints. §        §This role is responsible for managing and setting the strategic direction for the team in line with our Te ao Māori principals Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaugatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity), to embed a culture of regulatory excellence through education, advice, deterrence and enforcement.§        §This is your opportunity to play a key role in ensuring that participants within the transport industry are operating safely, improving standards and systems to ensure robust regulatory outcomes.§        § §        §About you | §Ko koe tēnei§        §As well as your leadership attributes, you will need to bring your ‘know how':§        §     Knowledge and Experience:§ within a large complex organisation§          §Deep understanding and expertise of the regulatory and compliance requirements of the New Zealand transport system§          §Experience in influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to achieve regulatory, safety compliance outcomes§          §Experience with managing financial delegations and meeting budget requirements§        §        §     Qualifications:§        §          §Tertiary qualifications at preferably post graduate level in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§        §        § §        §Applications close | §Rā Katinga :  Thursday, 15 October 2020§        § §        §For a copy of the position description, please visit: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the jobText: TXT/50622266.txt	§Senior Service Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Service Designer§§Advertiser: §Education Payroll Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Education Payroll is a dynamic Crown company charged with the privilege of building a brand new, online, payroll service for New Zealand’s 2,500 schools. We’re designing it with schools’ help, and it’ll make their payroll fast, accurate and easy.§ §The successful Senior Service Designer will be responsible for supporting our organisation to rethink how it does business. They will work to enhance the customer experience by using service design principles and tools. This will include helping the business to design and develop strategies, plans and services.§ §The Service Designer will work collaboratively with our Senior Leadership team, Product Owners and customers to develop a clear understanding of the problems and opportunities within the business. They will determine what prevent us from achieving our goals and work to co-develop future state solutions.§ §In return we can offer you the chance to support and impact the largest payroll system in New Zealand.§ §Key accountabilities§:§ § §Work with our customers to understand their needs and co-design solutions that are fit for purpose.§ §Elicit requirements using a variety of methods including interviews, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and data analysis.§ §Work closely with product owners and other business teams to develop efficient and effective solutions that meet the needs to the customer and that are based on research and insight.§ §Effectively scope work and assist senior leaders to make informed decisions on the prioritisation of work based on the voice of the customer.§ §Define and document existing business processes and help to manage their continual improvement§ §Provide input, document requirements and support the design and delivery of training and corresponding communications.§ §Facilitate design workshops with a broad cross-section of stakeholders, customers and partners to deliver the right outcomes.§ §Work with solution architects, solution designers, business analysts, business SMEs and other stakeholders to assess, design and deliver an efficient and effective process solution.§ §To excel in this role you will have:§ § §5+ years working with the design thinking methodology to develop new strategies, products, services and channels§ §Demonstrated experience in building and cultivating effective partnerships with a broad range of stakeholders from idea to delivery§ §Demonstrated experience in self-motivating, self-directed value driven working style with ability to partner with business teams to improve their processes and process knowledge§ §Knowledge of business requirements gathering, analysis and process mapping techniques§ §Excellent communication, facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills§ §Excellent analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills§ §Successful experience of analysing complex issues and developing effective options for action.§ §Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate at both a general business and technical level.§ §Experience working in an agile environment.§ §EPL embraces diversity and is committed to a culture that recognises and celebrates the collective uniqueness and contribution of all employees.§ §For more information about this position, please contact Aimie Benge at §myhr@edpay.nz§.§ §To apply for this position click the apply now button.§ §All applications will be treated in the strictest of confidence.§Applications close 5pm, Thursday, 8 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Technical Writer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633911.txt	§Senior Technical Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Technical Writer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Fixed-term, full-time (one year or two years)§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tēnā koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About the Early Learning and Student Achievement Group§At the heart of the work of the Early Learning and Student Achievement Group is making sure that every day, in every early learning service, kōhanga reo, school, and kura, the education workforce and curriculum delivery is world class, and focused on what New Zealanders need for their best future.§Secondary Tertiary is in the Early Learning and Student Achievement (ELSA) Group. It is responsible for setting the standards of NCEA qualifications that students study when they are at senior secondary school levels.§About this role§This recruitment is for multiple roles - Technical Writers and Senior Technical Writers.§You will work within the Production House team which is a new team that is part of the §Review of Achievement Standards§(RAS) project. The RAS project is a key mechanism for achieving the objectives in the §NCEA Change Programme§. Through the RAS, NCEA Level 1, 2 and 3 standards will be developed that are consistent with the policy goal of having more foundational learning at NCEA Level 1, with more specialisation at Levels 2-3. There are currently over 1,000 achievement standards across NCEA.§The Production House team works alongside the Senior Secondary team, and other teams, in developing products for the RAS project alongside leaders from the education sector.§Your will work alongside teachers and other stakeholders from the education sector to produce new standards and associated products for NCEA. You are responsible for providing technical (written) expertise so that high-quality written products are produced; and undertake analysis. You will work closely with a lead from the Senior Secondary team who will facilitate the stakeholder group(s) you support.§The roles report to the manager of the Production House team: Senior Manager, NCEA Product Delivery. The Production House is envisaged to comprise a moderate-sized team of about 9-11 technical writers (including a small number of senior roles). Recruitment will be rolling - so don't be discouraged from applying if you see the deadline is quite soon. Check back again.§About you§Just like New Zealand, we want our teams to be diverse. All applicants are encouraged to apply. To be successful in the role, you'll be comfortable with becoming the technical expert in a group setting and key driver of product development behind the scenes in the Ministry, and at times with NZQA (our partner in the project). You will work with other parts of our business to get products completed, to-time and to high quality.§Much of your production expertise can be expected to be developed on the job, as it relates to a new function and team being developed in the Ministry. Training will be provided but candidates should have strong written skills and attention to detail.§This would be a good entry position into a high profile government department with a great reputation. Prior experience in the education sector and/or in another government department would be desirable but not essential. Existing technical writers should apply but other people with skillsets like policy analysis should also consider this.§People who can think conceptually and produce documents to suit client and technical needs would do well in this role. You should be confident at discussing matters, undertaking research, performing analysis and presenting your contributions to small groups - both internally in the Ministry and externally as part of the RAS project.§A familiarity with project based methodologies like PRINCE2 would be advantageous but not essential.§We offer the following:§Exciting opportunity to be part of a new team and function as it is built within a leading government department§Opportunities to develop within the team over the course of a major project over the next five years§As training needs are identified the team will receive additional support§The Ministry operates flexible working arrangements meaning that you could be working from home at times§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§The Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi including working for and with Māori education professionals, teachers; and students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§To review this job is Te Reo please copt and paste this link in toy your browser: §https://expressonline.haineslink.co.nz/pdfs/663392_JobDesc.pdf§There is more information in the position description attached, please take a look and if this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§For further information, please contact the responsible Senior Manager: Simon Laube at §simon.laube@education.govt.nz§This recruitment process is for the formation of a new team so there are multiple roles to be filled. Please access the job application through the Ministry of Education Careers Centre.§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close Sunday, 11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Data Analyst Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50564365.txt	§Data Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Analyst§§Advertiser: §Springboard Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About Us§ §Springboard Trust is a unique charitable trust within the education sector, working to assist educational leaders enhance student achievement by strengthening strategic leadership capability in schools. This is achieved through capacity building amongst school leaders and providing them with access to cross-sector expertise drawn from New Zealand’s public, private and philanthropic communities.§ §About the Role§ §We have a new opportunity for a Data Analyst to work across our organisation to support us in our goal to continue to be an evidence based and data-driven organisation. The Analyst will be responsible for the accurate collection and analysis of data, with a view to develop skills in interpretation of data under the guidance of our Head of Evaluation & Research. § §In this role, the Analyst will support the development of Springboard evaluation systems, understanding the technical requirements and providing analysis and evaluation. This work will contribute to decisions across our services, funding and programmes to positively impact on school leaders and their learning communities. § §Ideally you will have basic experience as a Data Analyst, and an understanding of statistics.   You will need to be able to accurately collate, analyse and interpret data, be an excellent communicator and be both clear and succinct in report writing and presenting results. Being a team player and passionate about helping your colleagues is the key to your success in this role.  § §Responsibilities include:§ § §Data collection and Analysis:§ Support data integrity across the organisation, support the development of systems and strategies that optimise reporting efficiency and quality.§ §Evaluation and insights:§ Support the provision of programme and services evaluation through agreed robust and reliable data collection methods with a focus on continuous improvement.§ §Reporting:§ Provide data at an organisational level for the purpose of organisational governance and supporting the development and production of quarterly and annual reports (internal and external).§ §Ideal Experience and Qualifications:§ § §Analytical skills with the ability to accurately collect, analyse and interpret data§ §Strong communications skills, report writing and presenting findings§ §A working knowledge of  Microsoft Power BI, Power Query for Excel, Microsoft Office 365 Suite, statistical packages for analysing datasets, survey platforms. § §Experience working both independently & collaboratively within a team, with diverse roles and responsibilities§ §Good relationship management and customer service skills§ §A good sense of humour and able to work at times under pressure to achieve agreed deadlines§ §Take pride in attention to detail and getting stuff sorted§ §Experience with SPSS and knowledge about education trends in New Zealand and internationally is an advantage.§ §Location§ §This role is location-agnostic, while our office is situated in Onehunga, Auckland, our team is spread throughout the country. If you are comfortable working from home, with travel to Auckland or Waikato when required, then we welcome you to apply.§ §If you are looking for a new opportunity where you have the chance to add to your skill set, we look forward to hearing from you.  Please lodge your cover letter and C.V. via SEEK.  If you wish to learn more about the role please call Claire on §0275371825§ Monday - Wednesday.§ § § §Applications close Thursday 8th October. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a data analyst?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50548760.txt	§Senior Spatial Planning Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Spatial Planning Advisor§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Work on high profile projects§Contribute to the review of our district plan§Innovative and fun team environment§We are looking for a Senior Spatial Planning Advisor to join our Place Planning Team with proven experience in spatial planning, urban planning or resource management.§The Place Planning Team is responsible for leading the delivery of 'Planning for Growth' - one of our highest profile programmes. It will prepare our city for up to 80,000 more people over the next 30 years. To make this happen, we need talented people who share our passion for Wellington and aspire to excellence in urban planning.§You will be joining a dynamic team of professionals involved in the development of a 30-year spatial plan for Wellington City and be part of the full review of the District Plan. See our recently released Draft Spatial Plan here: https://planningforgrowth.wellington.govt.nz/spatial-plan.§In this role, you will be expected to lead key areas of work and assist other team members in:§Finalising the Draft Our City Tomorrow Spatial Plan Spatial Plan, and implementing key programmes§Develop and implement spatial planning initiatives for key parts of the City§Assisting with the District Plan review§Using innovative approaches to engaging with our iwi, business, and residential communities§What we would love to see is at least 5 years planning or resource management experience, preferably in a policy role. Key to your success in this role will be your excellent organisational and written skills with a proven ability to confidently communicate and advise the community, senior management and councillors on urban planning issues. You will be a team player who contributes to a positive, can-do culture within the Place Planning Team and the wider business unit. In return, we can offer you a collegial and flexible working environment with stimulating and rewarding work in Absolutely Positively Wellington, Smart Capital.§We also offer;§5 weeks annual leave after 2 years of continuous service for permanent staff§Flexible working arrangements§family leave provisions and a generously subsidised kid's school holiday programme.§Our services and projects are diverse and relate to all aspects of life in the city. We offer a wide range of careers, the chance to work with fantastic people, and many training and development opportunities.§Join us in making a positive difference - shape your own future, while contributing to the future of Wellington. If this opportunity is something that you are interested in, please make an application online. To submit an application and/or to the view the position description please click the apply button.§You are welcome to get in touch with John McSweeney, Place Planning Manager at §john.mcsweeney@wcc.govt.nz§ if you have any further questions. Applications for this role will close §11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§Needed is an Ecologist to join our busy Whanganui office. This will include but is not limited to field work, preparing assessments of ecological effects (AEE’s), providing technically sound and objective environmental management advice to clients. Every year PHARMAC makes more medicines available for more New Zealanders.§        §We are committed to championing workplace inclusion, acknowledging that in order to do their best work, people must be able to bring their whole selves to work and work in a way that best suits their individual needs. This includes supporting accessibility and being willing to make accommodations to facilitate the inclusion in the workplace of people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions.§        §The Role§        §The Strategic Planning and Performance team at PHARMAC is accountable for ensuring that PHARMAC's strategic planning, performance monitoring and accountability mechanisms are fit for purpose and support the organisation to achieve its new strategic direction.§        §Working closely with the Manager, Strategic Planning and Performance and Performance, the Senior/Principal Advisor, Planning & Performance provides high-quality advice and co-ordination (written and verbal) for strategy, planning, project and programme management, and performance reporting. The role will contribute to the implementation and ongoing improvement of an integrated planning process that aligns strategic, annual, and business planning, including resource and financial planning.§        §The Senior/Principal Advisor, Planning & Performance also plays a key role in developing PHARMAC's business plans and accountability documents. The position will have oversight of PHARMAC's performance framework and work alongside analysts and business owners to ensure measures are well documented and that as an organisation, we use performance information to drive better results.§        §SPP is a small team so the role has considerable scope for thought leadership and taking ownership of key pieces of work, as well as engaging with PHARMAC's Senior Leadership Team. The role is fixed-term for 12 months, to really drive and embed improvements to our planning reporting practices.§        §About You§        §We are seeking applications from people with strong experience in leading and supporting organisational planning and best practice performance reporting and measurement. We are flexible about appointing at senior advisor or principal level, depending on skills and experience.§        §You will be a natural communicator, with the ability to effectively build and manage relationships at all levels, including with senior leaders. You will bring:§        §          §a thorough understanding of the concepts and principles of strategy development, planning, project and programme management, performance reporting, and governance and accountability;§          §experience providing advice and support on effective reporting measurement frameworks, reporting measures, and big-picture analysis of what reports are telling us;§          §a good understanding of the system and operation of government and public management in New Zealand; an understanding of the accountability requirements for Crown Entities would be an advantage;§          §highly effective communication skills (written and verbal) and strong analytical skills, including the ability to draft well-argued papers for the Senior Leadership Team and the PHARMAC Board;§          §the ability to work independently as part of a multi-disciplinary team, and to work at pace when required;§          §a commitment to the Treaty of Waitangi and to equitable access and use of medicines;§          §a sense of humour and a willingness to pitch in across the team.§        §        §PHARMAC is a learning organisation that supports its people to develop and you will have a thirst to learn and use new skills to support our work.§        §PHARMAC is a pro-equity organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples' health gain [link removed] and we are open to exploring flexible work arrangements on request. We will contribute to relocation costs for those moving to Wellington to take up this role.§        §The PHARMAC model is unique. We are a small organisation (around 130 staff) where your expertise is respected and you can really make a difference for people. We take pride in what we do, work hard and have fun.§        §We will be considering applications as they are received, so apply today!§      §      §Catherine Proffitt§04 831 1338§ §    §    §  §§§If you want to make a difference to the lives of New Zealanders and thrive in a busy and challenging environment, we'd love to talk to you about joining the PHARMAC team.§About Us§PHARMAC is the Crown Entity that ensures New Zealanders have the medicines, medical devices and vaccines they need to help them get well and stay well. jobTitle: Programme Manager - East and Northwest Hamilton Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709470.txt	§Programme Manager - East and Northwest Hamilton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Manager - East and Northwest Hamilton§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Our City Growth Group is growing the Hamilton of the future. Every decision we make is contributing to the Hamilton of tomorrow, next year, next decade. We’re building a city that people are attracted to live and do business in now - while creating sustainable, vibrant communities as we continue to grow. We’re ambitious about the impact we can have for the city – join us to get your hands on shaping the Hamilton of today and maximising the opportunities of its growth.§We have an opportunity for a Programme Manager to join our Growth Programmes team. In this role you’ll initially be focussed on leading the overall delivery of the Ruakura (and eastern growth areas) and the Rotokauri (and northwest growth areas). You’ll build and lead a virtual, cross organisational team of multidisciplinary project managers and technical staff to ensure that they work together in a joined up way to deliver wellbeing outcomes for these new communities. Your daily focus will be on leading, communicating and corralling our internal teams and working closely with our Elected Members and key external partners including developers, landowners and key government agencies. You’ll also lead some specific projects, such as Business Cases, to support decision making on long term future investment into growth areas.§The right person for this role will have significant experience in Project or Programme Management. You may be a Project Manager looking to take your next step into Programme Management role. You do not need to be an engineer, a planner or a technical expert as we have those people in place delivering the projects. Your job will be to set up the temporary Programme frameworks that enable those teams to work together. You will have experience working in a complex, large work environment be it international, local government or from the private sector. High on your list of skills will be the ability to quickly form trusting relationships, the ability to lead people towards a common vision, outstanding communication skills and the ability to learn quickly and to see and implement new ways of doing things. You will also be highly organised and able to lead and prioritise your workload.§We are looking for a high-performer who is energised and ready to take on a new challenge. You’ll be joining a creative and supportive team who has your back, and will provide context and training to set you up to succeed.§This is a full-time role, based in central Hamilton. Our team can work from anywhere and mixes virtual with in-house, however the influential nature of the role means that you need to be in the building for a large portion of each week.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.
